data: {"title":"Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update","description":"Man United's task force group is still exploring options to regenerate Old Trafford.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814","content":"Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update
==========================================================================

Man United's task force group is still exploring options to regenerate Old Trafford.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments10](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   13:42, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30454856.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2166304524.jpg)

Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada. (Image: Ash Donelon/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Chief executive Omar Berrada has said Manchester United will analyse their options 'in the upcoming year' amid their plans to regenerate [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

United co-owner [Sir Jim Ratcliffe](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/sir-jim-ratcliffe) enlisted Lord Sebastian Coe and [Gary Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville) to join a task force back in March and the group has been exploring options to regenerate Old Trafford since.

The group first met in April and progress has been made with Ratcliffe's preference to build a brand-new stadium. [Sources indicated earlier this year that the task force hoped to conclude their findings by the end of 2024](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-reveal-very-positive-29600940).

**READ MORE:** **[United confirm profit as first quarter financial results announced](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)**

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

United have consulted supporters during the process and earlier this month [shared the results of a survey they distributed to season ticket holders, United members and executive club members](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/world-class-manchester-united-reveal-30299695). Fifty-two per cent of those who participated said they are in favour of a new stadium being constructed.

Issuing a fresh update on the landscape of the situation, Berrada has confirmed the task force is still conducting its investigation and it will not be until that is complete that United will then consider their plans.

"Our renovation of the Carrington Training Centre is progressing well, while the Old Trafford Regeneration Task Force continues its work," said Berrada.

"Once it has delivered its recommendations, we will then take some time to digest them and evaluate all our options in the upcoming year."

In March, Ratcliffe outlined his preference to build a new stadium, saying the club had the 'opportunity' to build a new arena that could house up to 100,000 supporters.

"It needs to have a stadium that's befitting the club and the brand," Ratcliffe told the [Geraint Thomas Cycling Club podcast](https://open.spotify.com/episode/6jp0G27S1yAe5FkBQqYkaC?si=95822aaf6ff14fc3&nd=1&dlsi=d33da2679a144d8c). "That might have been the case 20 years ago, but it isn't today.

"I mean we can refurbish the ground and we'll do a really nice job of that, it will be a fantastic stadium. And that would cost about a billion \[pounds\] to do that and the club can shoulder that burden.

"But you have got this opportunity if you choose to, to build a completely new ground because we have got enough space to build a completely new ground. If you built a completely new ground it would absolutely be state of the art, world-class, 90,000 or maybe even 100,000 (capacity)."

===============

Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update
==========================================================================

Man United's task force group is still exploring options to regenerate Old Trafford.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments10](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   13:42, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30454856.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2166304524.jpg)

Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada. (Image: Ash Donelon/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Chief executive Omar Berrada has said Manchester United will analyse their options 'in the upcoming year' amid their plans to regenerate [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

United co-owner [Sir Jim Ratcliffe](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/sir-jim-ratcliffe) enlisted Lord Sebastian Coe and [Gary Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville) to join a task force back in March and the group has been exploring options to regenerate Old Trafford since.

The group first met in April and progress has been made with Ratcliffe's preference to build a brand-new stadium. [Sources indicated earlier this year that the task force hoped to conclude their findings by the end of 2024](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-reveal-very-positive-29600940).

**READ MORE:** **[United confirm profit as first quarter financial results announced](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)**

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

United have consulted supporters during the process and earlier this month [shared the results of a survey they distributed to season ticket holders, United members and executive club members](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/world-class-manchester-united-reveal-30299695). Fifty-two per cent of those who participated said they are in favour of a new stadium being constructed.

Issuing a fresh update on the landscape of the situation, Berrada has confirmed the task force is still conducting its investigation and it will not be until that is complete that United will then consider their plans.

"Our renovation of the Carrington Training Centre is progressing well, while the Old Trafford Regeneration Task Force continues its work," said Berrada.

"Once it has delivered its recommendations, we will then take some time to digest them and evaluate all our options in the upcoming year."

In March, Ratcliffe outlined his preference to build a new stadium, saying the club had the 'opportunity' to build a new arena that could house up to 100,000 supporters.

"It needs to have a stadium that's befitting the club and the brand," Ratcliffe told the [Geraint Thomas Cycling Club podcast](https://open.spotify.com/episode/6jp0G27S1yAe5FkBQqYkaC?si=95822aaf6ff14fc3&nd=1&dlsi=d33da2679a144d8c). "That might have been the case 20 years ago, but it isn't today.

"I mean we can refurbish the ground and we'll do a really nice job of that, it will be a fantastic stadium. And that would cost about a billion \[pounds\] to do that and the club can shoulder that burden.

"But you have got this opportunity if you choose to, to build a completely new ground because we have got enough space to build a completely new ground. If you built a completely new ground it would absolutely be state of the art, world-class, 90,000 or maybe even 100,000 (capacity)."

Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his Manchester United plan
==============================================================================================

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim will have learnt a lot from his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town on Sunday.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim cuts a frustrated figure after Manchester United's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453263.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664290.jpg)

Ruben Amorim will want to see more from his players as the weeks go by. (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images.)

Today (Tuesday) marks exactly a year to the day since Kobbie Mainoo made his first Premier League start, starring in a 3-0 win for Manchester United over Everton at Goodison Park.

The midfielder had missed the start of the season after suffering an ankle injury in pre-season, and after three appearances on the bench, former United manager [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) made the decision to unleash him from the start against the Toffees.

That particular trip to Merseyside will always be remembered most for [Alejandro Garnacho's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) stunning acrobatic effort just three minutes in. However, Mainoo's performance was as equally impressive.

**READ MORE:** **[United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761)**

**READ MORE:** **['Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462)**

Sitting at the base of the midfield, the then-18-year-old bossed proceedings, leaving almost everyone watching in awe of just how accomplished he looked. You would have been forgiven for thinking he was making his 100th [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) start and not his first.

His performance at Goodison Park meant he immediately became a mainstay in Ten Hag's plans; he started 23 of [United's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) 25 remaining Premier League matches last season. He is a generational talent and United have incredibly high hopes for him.

However, the midfielder, after overcoming a six-week absence due to a muscle injury, was not deemed ready to make [Ruben Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) first United starting XI at Portman Road on Sunday. He was named on the bench alongside fellow midfielders Manuel Ugarte and Mason Mount.

Of that midfield trio, [Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo) was the only member of it not to step off the bench. But after several weeks on the sidelines, United are well within their rights not to rush his return.

But the fact he made the matchday squad has to be considered as a positive. He could make his first appearance of the Amorim era when Bodo/Glimt visit Old Trafford in the Europa League on Thursday night.

Amorim started with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in the centre of midfield on Sunday, supported by Diogo Dalot and [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) in the two wing-back roles. Eriksen and Casemiro, who helped form United's strongest midfield in 2022/23, have a combined age of 64.

  

![Image 3: Casemiro plays a pass to ease pressure from Ipswich Town ace Omari Hutchinson.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453145.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2186660711.jpg)

Casemiro started in a two-man midfield against Ipswich Town. (Image: Zohaib Alam - MUFC/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

What quickly became clear during Amorim's debut in the dugout, as expected, was that he wants United to play with energy and aggression. He wants his team to press high up the pitch and move the ball with both speed and purpose.

As experienced as both Casemiro and Eriksen are, they are unlikely to remain starters under Amorim. They have both enjoyed outstanding careers, but they are now each at a juncture where all they can offer is a short-term solution.

That fear was highlighted during Jamie Carragher's analysis of United's performance at Ipswich on _Monday Night Football,_ where he highlighted a point in the first half when Amorim was animated with Casemiro for not pressing higher up the pitch. Carragher argued the Brazilian did not appear to be comfortable with moving out of his natural habitat as a midfield destroyer in the No.6 berth.

By the time Mainoo turns 20 in April, Casemiro will have already celebrated his 33rd birthday, likewise Eriksen. Mainoo is 13 years their junior and will naturally have more energy in the tank.

The United academy graduate is a forward-thinking, progressive midfielder, who has the legs to get around the pitch much quicker. He can also move the ball faster and help United break the lines.

Had Mainoo not spent several weeks on the sidelines prior to Amorim's appointment, the chances are he would have started in Suffolk. The same could be said for Ugarte, who was away with Uruguay on international duty last week and only had two training sessions prior to the trip to Ipswich.

  

![Image 4: Kobbie Mainoo and Manuel Ugarte track the run of Crystal Palace midfielder Will Hughes.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30415719.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2173571204.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo (left) and Manuel Ugarte (right) have only started one game together for Manchester United. (Image: Harriet Lander/Getty Images.)

The general expectation is that Mainoo and Ugarte will end up forming Amorim's first-choice midfield. It is a combination that has the potential to become a long-term partnership.

Mainoo and Ugarte both have the legs and the energy required to press man-for-man. Amorim is evidently hungry for United to show more energy than what they have done so far this season.

As well as being happy to press, Mainoo can also add a turn of speed and athleticism to United's midfield, enabling them to progress the ball quicker. That particular trait was missing at Portman Road.

Without even playing a single minute under Amorim thus far, Mainoo's omission on Sunday highlighted just how important he could be. He could quite easily form the pillar of Amorim's vision.

data: {"title":"Ruben Amorim may have already found his most important player for his plan","description":"Man United head coach Ruben Amorim will have learnt a lot from his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town on Sunday.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668","content":"Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his Manchester United plan - George Smith - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his Manchester United plan
==============================================================================================

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim will have learnt a lot from his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town on Sunday.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments5](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   12:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim cuts a frustrated figure after Manchester United's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453263.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664290.jpg)

Ruben Amorim will want to see more from his players as the weeks go by. (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Today (Tuesday) marks exactly a year to the day since Kobbie Mainoo made his first Premier League start, starring in a 3-0 win for Manchester United over Everton at Goodison Park.

The midfielder had missed the start of the season after suffering an ankle injury in pre-season, and after three appearances on the bench, former United manager [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) made the decision to unleash him from the start against the Toffees.

That particular trip to Merseyside will always be remembered most for [Alejandro Garnacho's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) stunning acrobatic effort just three minutes in. However, Mainoo's performance was as equally impressive.

**READ MORE:** **[United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761)**

**READ MORE:** **['Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462)**

Sitting at the base of the midfield, the then-18-year-old bossed proceedings, leaving almost everyone watching in awe of just how accomplished he looked. You would have been forgiven for thinking he was making his 100th [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) start and not his first.

His performance at Goodison Park meant he immediately became a mainstay in Ten Hag's plans; he started 23 of [United's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) 25 remaining Premier League matches last season. He is a generational talent and United have incredibly high hopes for him.

However, the midfielder, after overcoming a six-week absence due to a muscle injury, was not deemed ready to make [Ruben Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) first United starting XI at Portman Road on Sunday. He was named on the bench alongside fellow midfielders Manuel Ugarte and Mason Mount.

Of that midfield trio, [Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo) was the only member of it not to step off the bench. But after several weeks on the sidelines, United are well within their rights not to rush his return.

But the fact he made the matchday squad has to be considered as a positive. He could make his first appearance of the Amorim era when Bodo/Glimt visit Old Trafford in the Europa League on Thursday night.

Amorim started with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in the centre of midfield on Sunday, supported by Diogo Dalot and [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) in the two wing-back roles. Eriksen and Casemiro, who helped form United's strongest midfield in 2022/23, have a combined age of 64.

  

![Image 3: Casemiro plays a pass to ease pressure from Ipswich Town ace Omari Hutchinson.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453145.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2186660711.jpg)

Casemiro started in a two-man midfield against Ipswich Town. (Image: Zohaib Alam - MUFC/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

What quickly became clear during Amorim's debut in the dugout, as expected, was that he wants United to play with energy and aggression. He wants his team to press high up the pitch and move the ball with both speed and purpose.

As experienced as both Casemiro and Eriksen are, they are unlikely to remain starters under Amorim. They have both enjoyed outstanding careers, but they are now each at a juncture where all they can offer is a short-term solution.

That fear was highlighted during Jamie Carragher's analysis of United's performance at Ipswich on _Monday Night Football,_ where he highlighted a point in the first half when Amorim was animated with Casemiro for not pressing higher up the pitch. Carragher argued the Brazilian did not appear to be comfortable with moving out of his natural habitat as a midfield destroyer in the No.6 berth.

By the time Mainoo turns 20 in April, Casemiro will have already celebrated his 33rd birthday, likewise Eriksen. Mainoo is 13 years their junior and will naturally have more energy in the tank.

The United academy graduate is a forward-thinking, progressive midfielder, who has the legs to get around the pitch much quicker. He can also move the ball faster and help United break the lines.

Had Mainoo not spent several weeks on the sidelines prior to Amorim's appointment, the chances are he would have started in Suffolk. The same could be said for Ugarte, who was away with Uruguay on international duty last week and only had two training sessions prior to the trip to Ipswich.

  

![Image 4: Kobbie Mainoo and Manuel Ugarte track the run of Crystal Palace midfielder Will Hughes.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30415719.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2173571204.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo (left) and Manuel Ugarte (right) have only started one game together for Manchester United. (Image: Harriet Lander/Getty Images.)

The general expectation is that Mainoo and Ugarte will end up forming Amorim's first-choice midfield. It is a combination that has the potential to become a long-term partnership.

Mainoo and Ugarte both have the legs and the energy required to press man-for-man. Amorim is evidently hungry for United to show more energy than what they have done so far this season.

As well as being happy to press, Mainoo can also add a turn of speed and athleticism to United's midfield, enabling them to progress the ball quicker. That particular trait was missing at Portman Road.

Without even playing a single minute under Amorim thus far, Mainoo's omission on Sunday highlighted just how important he could be. He could quite easily form the pillar of Amorim's vision.

data: {"title":"Ruben Amorim may have already found his most important player for his plan","description":"Man United head coach Ruben Amorim will have learnt a lot from his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town on Sunday.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668","content":"Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his Manchester United plan - George Smith - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his Manchester United plan
==============================================================================================

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim will have learnt a lot from his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town on Sunday.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments5](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   12:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim cuts a frustrated figure after Manchester United's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453263.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664290.jpg)

Ruben Amorim will want to see more from his players as the weeks go by. (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Today (Tuesday) marks exactly a year to the day since Kobbie Mainoo made his first Premier League start, starring in a 3-0 win for Manchester United over Everton at Goodison Park.

The midfielder had missed the start of the season after suffering an ankle injury in pre-season, and after three appearances on the bench, former United manager [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) made the decision to unleash him from the start against the Toffees.

That particular trip to Merseyside will always be remembered most for [Alejandro Garnacho's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) stunning acrobatic effort just three minutes in. However, Mainoo's performance was as equally impressive.

**READ MORE:** **[United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761)**

**READ MORE:** **['Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462)**

Sitting at the base of the midfield, the then-18-year-old bossed proceedings, leaving almost everyone watching in awe of just how accomplished he looked. You would have been forgiven for thinking he was making his 100th [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) start and not his first.

His performance at Goodison Park meant he immediately became a mainstay in Ten Hag's plans; he started 23 of [United's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) 25 remaining Premier League matches last season. He is a generational talent and United have incredibly high hopes for him.

However, the midfielder, after overcoming a six-week absence due to a muscle injury, was not deemed ready to make [Ruben Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) first United starting XI at Portman Road on Sunday. He was named on the bench alongside fellow midfielders Manuel Ugarte and Mason Mount.

Of that midfield trio, [Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo) was the only member of it not to step off the bench. But after several weeks on the sidelines, United are well within their rights not to rush his return.

But the fact he made the matchday squad has to be considered as a positive. He could make his first appearance of the Amorim era when Bodo/Glimt visit Old Trafford in the Europa League on Thursday night.

Amorim started with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in the centre of midfield on Sunday, supported by Diogo Dalot and [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) in the two wing-back roles. Eriksen and Casemiro, who helped form United's strongest midfield in 2022/23, have a combined age of 64.

  

![Image 3: Casemiro plays a pass to ease pressure from Ipswich Town ace Omari Hutchinson.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453145.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2186660711.jpg)

Casemiro started in a two-man midfield against Ipswich Town. (Image: Zohaib Alam - MUFC/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

What quickly became clear during Amorim's debut in the dugout, as expected, was that he wants United to play with energy and aggression. He wants his team to press high up the pitch and move the ball with both speed and purpose.

As experienced as both Casemiro and Eriksen are, they are unlikely to remain starters under Amorim. They have both enjoyed outstanding careers, but they are now each at a juncture where all they can offer is a short-term solution.

That fear was highlighted during Jamie Carragher's analysis of United's performance at Ipswich on _Monday Night Football,_ where he highlighted a point in the first half when Amorim was animated with Casemiro for not pressing higher up the pitch. Carragher argued the Brazilian did not appear to be comfortable with moving out of his natural habitat as a midfield destroyer in the No.6 berth.

By the time Mainoo turns 20 in April, Casemiro will have already celebrated his 33rd birthday, likewise Eriksen. Mainoo is 13 years their junior and will naturally have more energy in the tank.

The United academy graduate is a forward-thinking, progressive midfielder, who has the legs to get around the pitch much quicker. He can also move the ball faster and help United break the lines.

Had Mainoo not spent several weeks on the sidelines prior to Amorim's appointment, the chances are he would have started in Suffolk. The same could be said for Ugarte, who was away with Uruguay on international duty last week and only had two training sessions prior to the trip to Ipswich.

  

![Image 4: Kobbie Mainoo and Manuel Ugarte track the run of Crystal Palace midfielder Will Hughes.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30415719.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2173571204.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo (left) and Manuel Ugarte (right) have only started one game together for Manchester United. (Image: Harriet Lander/Getty Images.)

The general expectation is that Mainoo and Ugarte will end up forming Amorim's first-choice midfield. It is a combination that has the potential to become a long-term partnership.

Mainoo and Ugarte both have the legs and the energy required to press man-for-man. Amorim is evidently hungry for United to show more energy than what they have done so far this season.

As well as being happy to press, Mainoo can also add a turn of speed and athleticism to United's midfield, enabling them to progress the ball quicker. That particular trait was missing at Portman Road.

Without even playing a single minute under Amorim thus far, Mainoo's omission on Sunday highlighted just how important he could be. He could quite easily form the pillar of Amorim's vision.

Today (Tuesday) marks exactly a year to the day since Kobbie Mainoo made his first Premier League start, starring in a 3-0 win for Manchester United over Everton at Goodison Park.

The midfielder had missed the start of the season after suffering an ankle injury in pre-season, and after three appearances on the bench, former United manager [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) made the decision to unleash him from the start against the Toffees.

[](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)[Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/premier-league-managers-say-same-30433841?int_source=mantis_rec_top&int_medium=web&int_campaign=more_like_this_top_comments#comments-wrapper "Comments")

That particular trip to Merseyside will always be remembered most for [Alejandro Garnacho's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) stunning acrobatic effort just three minutes in. However, Mainoo's performance was as equally impressive.

**READ MORE:** **[United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761)**

**READ MORE:** **['Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462)**

Sitting at the base of the midfield, the then-18-year-old bossed proceedings, leaving almost everyone watching in awe of just how accomplished he looked. You would have been forgiven for thinking he was making his 100th [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) start and not his first.

His performance at Goodison Park meant he immediately became a mainstay in Ten Hag's plans; he started 23 of [United's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) 25 remaining Premier League matches last season. He is a generational talent and United have incredibly high hopes for him.

However, the midfielder, after overcoming a six-week absence due to a muscle injury, was not deemed ready to make [Ruben Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) first United starting XI at Portman Road on Sunday. He was named on the bench alongside fellow midfielders Manuel Ugarte and Mason Mount.

Of that midfield trio, [Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo) was the only member of it not to step off the bench. But after several weeks on the sidelines, United are well within their rights not to rush his return.

But the fact he made the matchday squad has to be considered as a positive. He could make his first appearance of the Amorim era when Bodo/Glimt visit Old Trafford in the Europa League on Thursday night.

Amorim started with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in the centre of midfield on Sunday, supported by Diogo Dalot and [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) in the two wing-back roles. Eriksen and Casemiro, who helped form United's strongest midfield in 2022/23, have a combined age of 64.

  

![Image 61: Casemiro plays a pass to ease pressure from Ipswich Town ace Omari Hutchinson.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453145.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2186660711.jpg)

Casemiro started in a two-man midfield against Ipswich Town. (Image: Zohaib Alam - MUFC/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

What quickly became clear during Amorim's debut in the dugout, as expected, was that he wants United to play with energy and aggression. He wants his team to press high up the pitch and move the ball with both speed and purpose.

As experienced as both Casemiro and Eriksen are, they are unlikely to remain starters under Amorim. They have both enjoyed outstanding careers, but they are now each at a juncture where all they can offer is a short-term solution.

That fear was highlighted during Jamie Carragher's analysis of United's performance at Ipswich on _Monday Night Football,_ where he highlighted a point in the first half when Amorim was animated with Casemiro for not pressing higher up the pitch. Carragher argued the Brazilian did not appear to be comfortable with moving out of his natural habitat as a midfield destroyer in the No.6 berth.

By the time Mainoo turns 20 in April, Casemiro will have already celebrated his 33rd birthday, likewise Eriksen. Mainoo is 13 years their junior and will naturally have more energy in the tank.

The United academy graduate is a forward-thinking, progressive midfielder, who has the legs to get around the pitch much quicker. He can also move the ball faster and help United break the lines.

Had Mainoo not spent several weeks on the sidelines prior to Amorim's appointment, the chances are he would have started in Suffolk. The same could be said for Ugarte, who was away with Uruguay on international duty last week and only had two training sessions prior to the trip to Ipswich.

  

![Image 62: Kobbie Mainoo and Manuel Ugarte track the run of Crystal Palace midfielder Will Hughes.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30415719.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2173571204.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo (left) and Manuel Ugarte (right) have only started one game together for Manchester United. (Image: Harriet Lander/Getty Images.)

The general expectation is that Mainoo and Ugarte will end up forming Amorim's first-choice midfield. It is a combination that has the potential to become a long-term partnership.

[](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)[Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/premier-league-managers-say-same-30433841?int_source=mantis_rec&int_medium=web&int_campaign=more_like_this_comments#comments-wrapper "Comments")

Mainoo and Ugarte both have the legs and the energy required to press man-for-man. Amorim is evidently hungry for United to show more energy than what they have done so far this season.

As well as being happy to press, Mainoo can also add a turn of speed and athleticism to United's midfield, enabling them to progress the ball quicker. That particular trait was missing at Portman Road.

Without even playing a single minute under Amorim thus far, Mainoo's omission on Sunday highlighted just how important he could be. He could quite easily form the pillar of Amorim's vision.

Man United's strongest line-up after Evan Ferguson signing as Ruben Amorim handed dream move
============================================================================================

Latest Manchester United transfer news and gossip as Brighton striker Evan Ferguson continues to be linked with a move to Old Trafford

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) may have been handed a major boost ahead of the January transfer window.

United have been linked with several potential new signings in recent months, with one of them being Brighton striker Evan Ferguson. It was reported by the [Daily Star](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/man-utd-weighing-up-50m-33435569) in August that United were weighing up a move to sign the Republic of Ireland international but would face competition from Chelsea.

United were reportedly considering a £50million bid to sign Ferguson, who scored six goals in 36 appearances last season. Brighton were reported to value Ferguson at £60million at the time, but now their stance has seemingly changed.

[The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/26/brighton-evan-ferguson-loan-january-transfer-window/) has reported that Brighton are willing to let Ferguson leave the Amex Stadium in January on loan for the remainder of the season. After valuing the 20-year-old at £60million just three months ago, it seems that the Seagulls want to give Ferguson more playing time after giving him just nine appearances with three starts under new manager Fabian Hurzeler.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

United have been heavily linked with signing a striker in recent months, and the update on Ferguson's future could be the perfect opportunity for the club to strengthen a key position. However, the signing of Ferguson could present questions for two members of the United squad.

Joshua Zirkzee and Rasmus Hojlund are United's current centre forward options, but have scored just three goals between them this season. Zirkzee was signed by United last summer from Bologna in a deal worth up to €42.5million (£35.5million).

Should United sign Ferguson, then it would leave United with a decision to make regarding the futures of Zirkzee and Hojlund. In Zirkzee's case, the striker has been linked with a loan move away from Old Trafford when the transfer window reopens in the New Year.

Ferguson would perform in a centre-forward role for United, likely with two wide forwards on either wing. They could be Alejandro Garnacho, Marcus Rashford, Bruno Fernandes, Amad Diallo or Antony, who are all options to play in the forward areas.

**_Potential United line-up after Evan Ferguson signing:_** _Onana; Mazraoui, De Ligt, Yoro, Martinez, Shaw; Mainoo, Ugarte; Fernandes, Ferguson, Garnacho_

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) may have been handed a major boost ahead of the January transfer window.

United have been linked with several potential new signings in recent months, with one of them being Brighton striker Evan Ferguson. It was reported by the [Daily Star](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/man-utd-weighing-up-50m-33435569) in August that United were weighing up a move to sign the Republic of Ireland international but would face competition from Chelsea.

United were reportedly considering a £50million bid to sign Ferguson, who scored six goals in 36 appearances last season. Brighton were reported to value Ferguson at £60million at the time, but now their stance has seemingly changed.

[The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/26/brighton-evan-ferguson-loan-january-transfer-window/) has reported that Brighton are willing to let Ferguson leave the Amex Stadium in January on loan for the remainder of the season. After valuing the 20-year-old at £60million just three months ago, it seems that the Seagulls want to give Ferguson more playing time after giving him just nine appearances with three starts under new manager Fabian Hurzeler.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

United have been heavily linked with signing a striker in recent months, and the update on Ferguson's future could be the perfect opportunity for the club to strengthen a key position. However, the signing of Ferguson could present questions for two members of the United squad.

Joshua Zirkzee and Rasmus Hojlund are United's current centre forward options, but have scored just three goals between them this season. Zirkzee was signed by United last summer from Bologna in a deal worth up to €42.5million (£35.5million).

Should United sign Ferguson, then it would leave United with a decision to make regarding the futures of Zirkzee and Hojlund. In Zirkzee's case, the striker has been linked with a loan move away from Old Trafford when the transfer window reopens in the New Year.

Ferguson would perform in a centre-forward role for United, likely with two wide forwards on either wing. They could be Alejandro Garnacho, Marcus Rashford, Bruno Fernandes, Amad Diallo or Antony, who are all options to play in the forward areas.

**_Potential United line-up after Evan Ferguson signing:_** _Onana; Mazraoui, De Ligt, Yoro, Martinez, Shaw; Mainoo, Ugarte; Fernandes, Ferguson, Garnacho_

Man United's strongest line-up after Evan Ferguson signing as Ruben Amorim handed dream move
============================================================================================

Latest Manchester United transfer news and gossip as Brighton striker Evan Ferguson continues to be linked with a move to Old Trafford
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Evan Ferguson of Brighton has been linked with Manchester United](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30458522.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_JS349742723.jpg)

Evan Ferguson of Brighton has been linked with Manchester United (Image: Mike Hewitt/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) may have been handed a major boost ahead of the January transfer window.

United have been linked with several potential new signings in recent months, with one of them being Brighton striker Evan Ferguson. It was reported by the [Daily Star](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/man-utd-weighing-up-50m-33435569) in August that United were weighing up a move to sign the Republic of Ireland international but would face competition from Chelsea.

United were reportedly considering a £50million bid to sign Ferguson, who scored six goals in 36 appearances last season. Brighton were reported to value Ferguson at £60million at the time, but now their stance has seemingly changed.

[The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/26/brighton-evan-ferguson-loan-january-transfer-window/) has reported that Brighton are willing to let Ferguson leave the Amex Stadium in January on loan for the remainder of the season. After valuing the 20-year-old at £60million just three months ago, it seems that the Seagulls want to give Ferguson more playing time after giving him just nine appearances with three starts under new manager Fabian Hurzeler.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

United have been heavily linked with signing a striker in recent months, and the update on Ferguson's future could be the perfect opportunity for the club to strengthen a key position. However, the signing of Ferguson could present questions for two members of the United squad.

Joshua Zirkzee and Rasmus Hojlund are United's current centre forward options, but have scored just three goals between them this season. Zirkzee was signed by United last summer from Bologna in a deal worth up to €42.5million (£35.5million).

Should United sign Ferguson, then it would leave United with a decision to make regarding the futures of Zirkzee and Hojlund. In Zirkzee's case, the striker has been linked with a loan move away from Old Trafford when the transfer window reopens in the New Year.

Ferguson would perform in a centre-forward role for United, likely with two wide forwards on either wing. They could be Alejandro Garnacho, Marcus Rashford, Bruno Fernandes, Amad Diallo or Antony, who are all options to play in the forward areas.

**_Potential United line-up after Evan Ferguson signing:_** _Onana; Mazraoui, De Ligt, Yoro, Martinez, Shaw; Mainoo, Ugarte; Fernandes, Ferguson, Garnacho_

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) may have been handed a major boost ahead of the January transfer window.

United have been linked with several potential new signings in recent months, with one of them being Brighton striker Evan Ferguson. It was reported by the [Daily Star](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/man-utd-weighing-up-50m-33435569) in August that United were weighing up a move to sign the Republic of Ireland international but would face competition from Chelsea.

United were reportedly considering a £50million bid to sign Ferguson, who scored six goals in 36 appearances last season. Brighton were reported to value Ferguson at £60million at the time, but now their stance has seemingly changed.

[The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/26/brighton-evan-ferguson-loan-january-transfer-window/) has reported that Brighton are willing to let Ferguson leave the Amex Stadium in January on loan for the remainder of the season. After valuing the 20-year-old at £60million just three months ago, it seems that the Seagulls want to give Ferguson more playing time after giving him just nine appearances with three starts under new manager Fabian Hurzeler.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

United have been heavily linked with signing a striker in recent months, and the update on Ferguson's future could be the perfect opportunity for the club to strengthen a key position. However, the signing of Ferguson could present questions for two members of the United squad.

Joshua Zirkzee and Rasmus Hojlund are United's current centre forward options, but have scored just three goals between them this season. Zirkzee was signed by United last summer from Bologna in a deal worth up to €42.5million (£35.5million).

Should United sign Ferguson, then it would leave United with a decision to make regarding the futures of Zirkzee and Hojlund. In Zirkzee's case, the striker has been linked with a loan move away from Old Trafford when the transfer window reopens in the New Year.

Ferguson would perform in a centre-forward role for United, likely with two wide forwards on either wing. They could be Alejandro Garnacho, Marcus Rashford, Bruno Fernandes, Amad Diallo or Antony, who are all options to play in the forward areas.

**_Potential United line-up after Evan Ferguson signing:_** _Onana; Mazraoui, De Ligt, Yoro, Martinez, Shaw; Mainoo, Ugarte; Fernandes, Ferguson, Garnacho_

Hello and welcome to our Manchester United live blog on Tuesday, November 26.

Last weekend, Ruben Amorim's tenure at United started with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town. After the game, the Portuguese manager emphasised that some problems will take a while to get fixed.

They did get to the best start possible within 80 seconds through Marcus Rashford, who scored the opener. But [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) later struggled to maintain a concerted presence in the final third.

The result means they have yet to score more than one goal in a Premier League game away from home since September 14. The point took them up a place to 12th in the table, having won only a third of their 12 league matches so far.

With the January transfer window just around the corner, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) may have a limited budget to spend after a heavy spending in the summer. However, Amorim has vowed not to buy any of his former players at Sporting CP in the new year, meaning moves for Viktor Gyokeres and [interest Geovany Quenda](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/geovany-quenda-transfer-latest-man-30420012) are out of the question.

With that said, MEN Sport will keep you covered with the transfer latest throughout the day. So stay up to date with all of the latest Manchester United news in our live blog below.

22:52Kieran Horn

### Arsenal send clear Ruben Amorim message

Manchester United may well have appointed the next big thing in management judging by how Sporting CP's first Champions League game without Ruben Amorim played out.

In his last home clash, the Portuguese champions beat Manchester City 4-1. However, just a few weeks later they were on the end of a battering by an English team. Arsenal rocked up to Jose Alvalade Stadium following a comfortable 3-0 victory against Nottingham Forest and again showed their attacking power.

At half time, it was 3-0 to the Gunners with the final score being 5-1, though it could have been much more. While Sporting were missing key players, it is telling how they got on without Amorim at the helm against elite-level opposition.

As such, it seems clear that Amorim is a very talented coach and given time will be able to bring success back to Old Trafford.

![Image 2](https://i2-prod.birminghammail.co.uk/incoming/article30453983.ece/ALTERNATES/s510b/1_SOCCER_Ipswich_10015209.jpg)

Ruben Amorim (Image: (Bradley Collyer/PA Wire))

21:41Kieran Horn

### Strongest United line-up with Ferguson

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) may have been handed a major boost ahead of the January transfer window.

United have been linked with several potential new signings in recent months, with one of them being Brighton striker Evan Ferguson. It was reported by the [Daily Star](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/man-utd-weighing-up-50m-33435569) in August that United were weighing up a move to sign the Republic of Ireland international but would face competition from Chelsea.

And now, after a tough start to the season, [The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/26/brighton-evan-ferguson-loan-january-transfer-window/) has reported that Brighton are willing to let Ferguson leave the Amex Stadium in January on loan for the remainder of the season.

20:56Kieran Horn

### Gyokeres opening 45 minutes vs Arsenal

That was a very difficult first half for Viktor Gyokeres and Sporting CP with Arsenal ahead courtesy of goals from Gabriel Martinelli, Kai Havertz and Gabriel Magalhaes.

In his last European outing, which was Ruben Amorim's final home game before joining Manchester United, the Swede bagged a hat-trick against Manchester City but barely touched the ball in the opening 45 against the Gunners.

He did have some nice touches and his strong hold up play was on show but Gabriel and William Saliba mostly dealt with his threat.

20:30Amie Wilson

### Van Nistelrooy could provide United with transfer boost

There has been a lot of talk over the future of [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) since his [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) exit just a couple of weeks ago.

The former striker returned to United in the summer as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The manager’s sacking in October led to van Nistelrooy taking interim charge of the club.

In his four games in charge, United won three and drew one. Two of those wins came against Leicester City - a 5-2 Carabao Cup victory and a 3-0 win in the Premier League.

He has now been heavily linked with the Leicester City job.[**Read here**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-could-help-30458046) for four United players that the former coach could potentially sign with his new club.

20:03Amie Wilson

### Ruben Amorim identifies key transfer target

Manchester United are reportedly interested in Napoli winger Khvicha Kvaratskhelia ahead of the January transfer window, with the player in a contract stand-off with his current club.

Sportmediaset, via [Get Italian Football News](https://www.getfootballnewsitaly.com/2024/manchester-united-serious-in-move-for-napolis-khvicha-kvaratskhelia/) report that United are 'serious' about the player, but would need to offer a fee of around €100 million (£83.48m) to temp Napoli into selling.

Napoli are keen on getting the player tied down to a new contract, with his current one expiring in 2027. However, no agreement has yet been reached.

19:37Amie Wilson

### Neville spots Man United 'red flags'

Gary Neville has explained why Ruben Amorim will be fully aware of the 'red flags' at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

Amorim's reign as United head coach began on Sunday with a 1-1 draw away at Ipswich Town. The stalemate leaves United in 12th place in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) table and will next face Everton in the top flight after taking on Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

Before [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) appointment, United had won just three of their first 10 Premier League matches this season, as well as four defeats. The draw with Ipswich still leaves United in the bottom half of the Premier League table but just six points adrift of the top four spots.

**[Read more here](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/gary-neville-spots-man-united-30457486).**

### Amorim could hand United man a lifeline

He told [PaddyPower](https://www.paddypower.com/football/english-premier-league):

> "If Harry Maguire knocked on Ruben Amorim’s door, he’ll have a look at him and see what he’s got.
> 
> "With every player – and there’s lots of them – he has to look at each one, but in the meantime, he must get results.
> 
> "If Harry Maguire plays as the middle of Amorim’s back three, he’ll be comfortable. It’s just that he doesn’t have that half a yard of pace. Ruben Amorim might think he can put him in the middle with two guys either side who have legs and see how they go."

15:22Josh Holland

### Quenda transfer hint

Geovany Quenda posed for a photo during the international break in a retro Portugal shirt with the number seven on the front that has become synonymous with [Cristiano Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo).

He previously wore the number 17 at Euro 2004 and the 2006 [World Cup](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/world-cup), the only two tournaments they played together at. At the former, which Portugal hosted and reached the final before losing to Greece, the shirts they wore were in the Nike Total 90 template.

Quenda has yet to debut for the senior national team despite twice being called up this autumn but could well be in line to assume the seven shirt when Ronaldo eventually retires.

14:39Josh Holland

### Southgate hints at next role

Gareth Southgate has revealed he may never return to management after leaving England - as he admitted he was "contemplating a change of direction".

The 54-year-old has been linked with several [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) jobs, including [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and Everton, since stepping down from his role with the Three Lions after this summer's second place finish at the European Championships.

Writing on Linkedin, Southgate said: "Coaching top players was a challenge that pushed me to operate at the very highest level. The weight of the role with the unique responsibility it carried was something few ever get to experience."

12:44Josh Holland

### Berrard sets out season sights

Man United have released their first quarter fiscal 2025 results and Omar Berrada has highlighted the hierachy's intentions to return the club to the top of football.

"The season is now well underway for both our men’s and women’s team, and we are keen to ensure both are as competitive as possible.

"We are delighted to have appointed Ruben Amorim as head coach of our men’s team and remain committed to returning Manchester United to the top of domestic and European football.

"Our cost and headcount reductions remain on track, and we are pleased to have seen further commercial traction, and welcome new partner Heineken, through their Tiger brand.

"Our renovation of the Carrington Training Centre is progressing well, while the Old Trafford Regeneration Task Force continues its work. Once it has delivered its recommendations, we will then take some time to digest them and evaluate all our options in the upcoming year.”

11:59Bruna Reis

### Gary Neville delivers Man United assessment after Ipswich draw

Gary Neville has delivered a scathing assessment of Man United's performance vs Ipswich Town.

The sides drew 1-1 after Marcus Rashford scored the opening goal inside 80 seconds.

> "I mean, the red flags that were there yesterday have probably been there in the last few months and the last season and a half," Neville told Sky Sports. "It's a team that is very difficult to actually like watching, and I say that with respect because I genuinely do believe what Ruben Amorim said at the end of the game.
> 
> "No football player goes out onto the pitch and wants to lose or doesn't want to win or work hard or do well. They don't want criticism. But you watch them play, even yesterday, in the new system, and you look at Ipswich, who are very near the bottom of the league.
> 
> "They looked more organised, \[like they had a\] better coach, they looked like they had more appetite for the game and more enthusiasm. And that's a constant, and it has been a constant, not just, obviously, on Sunday, but a constant for the last year and a half, two years, three years.
> 
> "So we've got a situation where these group of players, to be honest with you, have created a pattern for themselves and become what they are. And it wasn't just a red flag yesterday because the same things that we've seen in the last six to eight months, 10 months, we saw yesterday.
> 
> "With Ruben Amorim being the manager, he saw it as well. I think he obviously knew how big a job this was. I think he recognised that."

### Chido Obi-Martin decision made ahead of European fixture

Chido Obi-Martin could star in Manchester United Under-19s game against AZ Alkmaar on Tuesday afternoon.

The UEFA Youth League is a competition for academy sides of clubs who qualified for the [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league), but United's youngsters forced their way into the competition. The Youth League is seen as a challenging but prestigious competition by academy staff and United will play AZ Alkmaar in the third round first leg in the Netherlands on Tuesday.

The U19s' game against AZ Alkmaar kicks off at 4pm on Tuesday and the exciting Obi-Martin, who signed from Arsenal in the summer, was among those to be included in the squad. He has contributed four goals and an assist in two starts for the U18s this season and the prolific youth striker has given the impression that he could step up the Under-21s.

### Kobbie Mainoo theory

Danny Murphy has suggested that Kobbie Mainoo could have no future at Manchester United following the arrival of Ruben Amorim.

Mainoo returned to the matchday squad for Ipswich Town but wasn't among the five substitutes brought on by Amorim. Manuel Ugarte meanwhile, featured off the bench after reuniting with Amorim.

Murphy believes Amorim's long-term vision for the midfield double pivot in his 3-4-3 system will involve Ugarte and a new signing.

> "To play that role well, United's midfielders will need to be more than just mobile, too," he told BBC Sport. "They will both have to love the defensive side of the game and be able to spot danger and then be fast enough to stop it. In the long run, I think Manuel Ugarte will be one of them.

> "He needs a run of games to get his sharpness back, but we have seen glimpses of how good he is, for example, in the Europa League against Fenerbahce last month, and he has flourished under Amorim at Sporting before.
> 
> "As for who Ugarte will have alongside him, well, it will probably be someone who is not at the club at the moment. There is going to have to be activity in the next couple of transfer windows for them to get the type of player Amorim requires."

Man United transfer news LIVE: Viktor Gyokeres update, New striker claim, Geovany Quenda 'approach'
===================================================================================================

Keep up to date with the latest Man United transfer news and gossip following Ruben Amorim's opening draw at Ipswich Town.

![Image 1: Victor Boniface](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article28485555.ece/ALTERNATES/s1200/0_victor-boniface.jpg)

Bayer Leverkusen striker Victor Boniface (Image: Jörg Schüler/Bayer 04 Leverkusen via Getty Images)

Hello and welcome to our Manchester United live blog on Tuesday, November 26.

Last weekend, Ruben Amorim's tenure at United started with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town. After the game, the Portuguese manager emphasised that some problems will take a while to get fixed.

They did get to the best start possible within 80 seconds through Marcus Rashford, who scored the opener. But [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) later struggled to maintain a concerted presence in the final third.

The result means they have yet to score more than one goal in a Premier League game away from home since September 14. The point took them up a place to 12th in the table, having won only a third of their 12 league matches so far.

With the January transfer window just around the corner, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) may have a limited budget to spend after a heavy spending in the summer. However, Amorim has vowed not to buy any of his former players at Sporting CP in the new year, meaning moves for Viktor Gyokeres and [interest Geovany Quenda](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/geovany-quenda-transfer-latest-man-30420012) are out of the question.

With that said, MEN Sport will keep you covered with the transfer latest throughout the day. So stay up to date with all of the latest Manchester United news in our live blog below.

22:52Kieran Horn

### Arsenal send clear Ruben Amorim message

Manchester United may well have appointed the next big thing in management judging by how Sporting CP's first Champions League game without Ruben Amorim played out.

In his last home clash, the Portuguese champions beat Manchester City 4-1. However, just a few weeks later they were on the end of a battering by an English team. Arsenal rocked up to Jose Alvalade Stadium following a comfortable 3-0 victory against Nottingham Forest and again showed their attacking power.

At half time, it was 3-0 to the Gunners with the final score being 5-1, though it could have been much more. While Sporting were missing key players, it is telling how they got on without Amorim at the helm against elite-level opposition.

As such, it seems clear that Amorim is a very talented coach and given time will be able to bring success back to Old Trafford.

![Image 2](https://i2-prod.birminghammail.co.uk/incoming/article30453983.ece/ALTERNATES/s510b/1_SOCCER_Ipswich_10015209.jpg)

Ruben Amorim (Image: (Bradley Collyer/PA Wire))

21:41Kieran Horn

### Strongest United line-up with Ferguson

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) may have been handed a major boost ahead of the January transfer window.

United have been linked with several potential new signings in recent months, with one of them being Brighton striker Evan Ferguson. It was reported by the [Daily Star](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/man-utd-weighing-up-50m-33435569) in August that United were weighing up a move to sign the Republic of Ireland international but would face competition from Chelsea.

### Gary Neville delivers Man United assessment after Ipswich draw

Gary Neville has delivered a scathing assessment of Man United's performance vs Ipswich Town.

The sides drew 1-1 after Marcus Rashford scored the opening goal inside 80 seconds.

> "I mean, the red flags that were there yesterday have probably been there in the last few months and the last season and a half," Neville told Sky Sports. "It's a team that is very difficult to actually like watching, and I say that with respect because I genuinely do believe what Ruben Amorim said at the end of the game.
> 
> "No football player goes out onto the pitch and wants to lose or doesn't want to win or work hard or do well. They don't want criticism. But you watch them play, even yesterday, in the new system, and you look at Ipswich, who are very near the bottom of the league.
> 
> "They looked more organised, \[like they had a\] better coach, they looked like they had more appetite for the game and more enthusiasm. And that's a constant, and it has been a constant, not just, obviously, on Sunday, but a constant for the last year and a half, two years, three years.
> 
> "So we've got a situation where these group of players, to be honest with you, have created a pattern for themselves and become what they are. And it wasn't just a red flag yesterday because the same things that we've seen in the last six to eight months, 10 months, we saw yesterday.
> 
> "With Ruben Amorim being the manager, he saw it as well. I think he obviously knew how big a job this was. I think he recognised that."

### Joshua Zirkzee interest

Caught Offside reports Aston Villa are the latest team to join the list of Zirkzee’s admirers.

However, they are set to face stiff competition from Serie A, with Juventus, Milan, Napoli, and Inter are also keen on securing the striker's services. It's said that Juve is the 'ideal destination' for the Dutch as he would have the opportunity to reunite with his former manager Thiago Motta.

07:46Bruna Reis

### Ruben Amorim wish

According to [Caught Offside](https://www.caughtoffside.com/2024/11/25/ruben-amorim-ousmane-diomande-transfer/), Amorim is determined to reunite with the defender at Old Trafford.

The article claims that United will face competition from [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc), [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) and Arsenal for the signing of Diomande. 07:42Bruna Reis

### Rayan Ait-Nouri 'interest'

The Sun reports Wolves' Rayan Ait-Nouri is 'high on the wishlist' of Ruben Amorim.

The Portuguese manager is said to want to reinforce his options give Luke Shaw's injury record. There is a possibility that Shaw could also eventually move into the back-three once Amorim fully instils his 3-4-3 system at the club.

Ait-Nouri, an attacking wing-back, is believed to tick all of the boxes for Amorim and the style of the football he likes to play. He has also been linked with a move to Liverpool.

07:39Bruna Reis

### Geovany Quenda 'approach'

Portuguese news outlet [A Bola](http://abola.pt/) claims Man United have intensified their interest in signing Geovany Quenda ahead of the transfer window.

The report claims that United already made an initial approach over the future of Quenda in October, before appointing Amorim as head coach. It has been reported that United are ready to make an offer worth €60million (£50million) to sign the teenager.

The 17-year-old forward has a €100million (£83.5million) release clause in his contract that he extended earlier this year which runs until 2027.

Hello and welcome to our Manchester United live blog on Tuesday, November 26.

Last weekend, Ruben Amorim's tenure at United started with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town. After the game, the Portuguese manager emphasised that some problems will take a while to get fixed.

They did get to the best start possible within 80 seconds through Marcus Rashford, who scored the opener. But [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) later struggled to maintain a concerted presence in the final third.

The result means they have yet to score more than one goal in a Premier League game away from home since September 14. The point took them up a place to 12th in the table, having won only a third of their 12 league matches so far.

With the January transfer window just around the corner, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) may have a limited budget to spend after a heavy spending in the summer. However, Amorim has vowed not to buy any of his former players at Sporting CP in the new year, meaning moves for Viktor Gyokeres and [interest Geovany Quenda](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/geovany-quenda-transfer-latest-man-30420012) are out of the question.

With that said, MEN Sport will keep you covered with the transfer latest throughout the day. So stay up to date with all of the latest Manchester United news in our live blog below.

22:52Kieran Horn

### Arsenal send clear Ruben Amorim message

Manchester United may well have appointed the next big thing in management judging by how Sporting CP's first Champions League game without Ruben Amorim played out.

In his last home clash, the Portuguese champions beat Manchester City 4-1. However, just a few weeks later they were on the end of a battering by an English team. Arsenal rocked up to Jose Alvalade Stadium following a comfortable 3-0 victory against Nottingham Forest and again showed their attacking power.

At half time, it was 3-0 to the Gunners with the final score being 5-1, though it could have been much more. While Sporting were missing key players, it is telling how they got on without Amorim at the helm against elite-level opposition.

As such, it seems clear that Amorim is a very talented coach and given time will be able to bring success back to Old Trafford.

![Image 2](https://i2-prod.birminghammail.co.uk/incoming/article30453983.ece/ALTERNATES/s510b/1_SOCCER_Ipswich_10015209.jpg)

Ruben Amorim (Image: (Bradley Collyer/PA Wire))

### Strongest United line-up with Ferguson

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) may have been handed a major boost ahead of the January transfer window.

United have been linked with several potential new signings in recent months, with one of them being Brighton striker Evan Ferguson. It was reported by the [Daily Star](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/man-utd-weighing-up-50m-33435569) in August that United were weighing up a move to sign the Republic of Ireland international but would face competition from Chelsea.

And now, after a tough start to the season, [The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/26/brighton-evan-ferguson-loan-january-transfer-window/) has reported that Brighton are willing to let Ferguson leave the Amex Stadium in January on loan for the remainder of the season.

20:56Kieran Horn

### Gyokeres opening 45 minutes vs Arsenal

That was a very difficult first half for Viktor Gyokeres and Sporting CP with Arsenal ahead courtesy of goals from Gabriel Martinelli, Kai Havertz and Gabriel Magalhaes.

In his last European outing, which was Ruben Amorim's final home game before joining Manchester United, the Swede bagged a hat-trick against Manchester City but barely touched the ball in the opening 45 against the Gunners.

He did have some nice touches and his strong hold up play was on show but Gabriel and William Saliba mostly dealt with his threat.

### Van Nistelrooy could provide United with transfer boost

There has been a lot of talk over the future of [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) since his [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) exit just a couple of weeks ago.

The former striker returned to United in the summer as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The manager’s sacking in October led to van Nistelrooy taking interim charge of the club.

In his four games in charge, United won three and drew one. Two of those wins came against Leicester City - a 5-2 Carabao Cup victory and a 3-0 win in the Premier League.

He has now been heavily linked with the Leicester City job.[**Read here**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-could-help-30458046) for four United players that the former coach could potentially sign with his new club.

### Ruben Amorim identifies key transfer target

Manchester United are reportedly interested in Napoli winger Khvicha Kvaratskhelia ahead of the January transfer window, with the player in a contract stand-off with his current club.

Sportmediaset, via [Get Italian Football News](https://www.getfootballnewsitaly.com/2024/manchester-united-serious-in-move-for-napolis-khvicha-kvaratskhelia/) report that United are 'serious' about the player, but would need to offer a fee of around €100 million (£83.48m) to temp Napoli into selling.

Napoli are keen on getting the player tied down to a new contract, with his current one expiring in 2027. However, no agreement has yet been reached.
