19:37Amie Wilson

### Neville spots Man United 'red flags'

Gary Neville has explained why Ruben Amorim will be fully aware of the 'red flags' at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

Amorim's reign as United head coach began on Sunday with a 1-1 draw away at Ipswich Town. The stalemate leaves United in 12th place in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) table and will next face Everton in the top flight after taking on Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

Before [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) appointment, United had won just three of their first 10 Premier League matches this season, as well as four defeats. The draw with Ipswich still leaves United in the bottom half of the Premier League table but just six points adrift of the top four spots.

15:22Josh Holland

### Quenda transfer hint

Geovany Quenda posed for a photo during the international break in a retro Portugal shirt with the number seven on the front that has become synonymous with [Cristiano Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo).

He previously wore the number 17 at Euro 2004 and the 2006 [World Cup](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/world-cup), the only two tournaments they played together at. At the former, which Portugal hosted and reached the final before losing to Greece, the shirts they wore were in the Nike Total 90 template.

Quenda has yet to debut for the senior national team despite twice being called up this autumn but could well be in line to assume the seven shirt when Ronaldo eventually retires.

### Southgate hints at next role

Gareth Southgate has revealed he may never return to management after leaving England - as he admitted he was "contemplating a change of direction".

The 54-year-old has been linked with several [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) jobs, including [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and Everton, since stepping down from his role with the Three Lions after this summer's second place finish at the European Championships.

Writing on Linkedin, Southgate said: "Coaching top players was a challenge that pushed me to operate at the very highest level. The weight of the role with the unique responsibility it carried was something few ever get to experience."

### Berrard sets out season sights

Man United have released their first quarter fiscal 2025 results and Omar Berrada has highlighted the hierachy's intentions to return the club to the top of football.

"The season is now well underway for both our men’s and women’s team, and we are keen to ensure both are as competitive as possible.

"We are delighted to have appointed Ruben Amorim as head coach of our men’s team and remain committed to returning Manchester United to the top of domestic and European football.

"Our cost and headcount reductions remain on track, and we are pleased to have seen further commercial traction, and welcome new partner Heineken, through their Tiger brand.

"Our renovation of the Carrington Training Centre is progressing well, while the Old Trafford Regeneration Task Force continues its work. Once it has delivered its recommendations, we will then take some time to digest them and evaluate all our options in the upcoming year.”

11:59Bruna Reis

### Gary Neville delivers Man United assessment after Ipswich draw

Gary Neville has delivered a scathing assessment of Man United's performance vs Ipswich Town.

The sides drew 1-1 after Marcus Rashford scored the opening goal inside 80 seconds.

> "I mean, the red flags that were there yesterday have probably been there in the last few months and the last season and a half," Neville told Sky Sports. "It's a team that is very difficult to actually like watching, and I say that with respect because I genuinely do believe what Ruben Amorim said at the end of the game.
> 
> "No football player goes out onto the pitch and wants to lose or doesn't want to win or work hard or do well. They don't want criticism. But you watch them play, even yesterday, in the new system, and you look at Ipswich, who are very near the bottom of the league.
> 
> "They looked more organised, \[like they had a\] better coach, they looked like they had more appetite for the game and more enthusiasm. And that's a constant, and it has been a constant, not just, obviously, on Sunday, but a constant for the last year and a half, two years, three years.
> 
> "So we've got a situation where these group of players, to be honest with you, have created a pattern for themselves and become what they are. And it wasn't just a red flag yesterday because the same things that we've seen in the last six to eight months, 10 months, we saw yesterday.
> 
> "With Ruben Amorim being the manager, he saw it as well. I think he obviously knew how big a job this was. I think he recognised that."

### Chido Obi-Martin decision made ahead of European fixture

Chido Obi-Martin could star in Manchester United Under-19s game against AZ Alkmaar on Tuesday afternoon.

The UEFA Youth League is a competition for academy sides of clubs who qualified for the [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league), but United's youngsters forced their way into the competition. The Youth League is seen as a challenging but prestigious competition by academy staff and United will play AZ Alkmaar in the third round first leg in the Netherlands on Tuesday.

The U19s' game against AZ Alkmaar kicks off at 4pm on Tuesday and the exciting Obi-Martin, who signed from Arsenal in the summer, was among those to be included in the squad. He has contributed four goals and an assist in two starts for the U18s this season and the prolific youth striker has given the impression that he could step up the Under-21s.

### Swap deal on the cards?

### Harry Maguire agrees with Ruben Amorim

The United defender has backed up Amorim's claim that the Red Devils were "overthinking" in their disappointing 1-1 draw to Ipswich Town on Sunday.

> He said: "When you come from one style to another style, like the manager said in his interview after, I think people on the pitch are thinking too much where they want to be," he said. "At the end of the day, it's a football match. Go and be better than your opponent and go and win the football match. Within that, play with his principles.
> 
> "I think we overthought the game against Ipswich. I think that's natural because the boys want to play the way the manager wants to play. I think we've got to let it adapt with fluent rather than forcing it."

08:24Bruna Reis

### Kobbie Mainoo theory

Danny Murphy has suggested that Kobbie Mainoo could have no future at Manchester United following the arrival of Ruben Amorim.

Mainoo returned to the matchday squad for Ipswich Town but wasn't among the five substitutes brought on by Amorim. Manuel Ugarte meanwhile, featured off the bench after reuniting with Amorim.

Murphy believes Amorim's long-term vision for the midfield double pivot in his 3-4-3 system will involve Ugarte and a new signing.

> "To play that role well, United's midfielders will need to be more than just mobile, too," he told BBC Sport. "They will both have to love the defensive side of the game and be able to spot danger and then be fast enough to stop it. In the long run, I think Manuel Ugarte will be one of them.

> "He needs a run of games to get his sharpness back, but we have seen glimpses of how good he is, for example, in the Europa League against Fenerbahce last month, and he has flourished under Amorim at Sporting before.
> 
> "As for who Ugarte will have alongside him, well, it will probably be someone who is not at the club at the moment. There is going to have to be activity in the next couple of transfer windows for them to get the type of player Amorim requires."

Ruud van Nistelrooy could help Manchester United complete four transfers amid new job talk
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United transfer news and opinion as the former striker is the bookmakers odds-on favourite for the vacant Leicester City job.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   19:30, 26 NOV 2024
*   Updated19:34, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruud van Nistelrooy during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD4 match between Manchester United and PAOK FC at Old Trafford.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30458094.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United-v-PAOK-FC-UEFA-Europa-League-202425-League-Phase-MD4.jpg)

Ruud van Nisterooy is odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester City following his exit from Manchester United. (Image: Naomi Baker/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

There has been a lot of talk over the future of [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) since his [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) exit just a couple of weeks ago.

The former striker returned to United in the summer as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The manager’s sacking in October led to van Nistelrooy taking interim charge of the club.

In his four games in charge, United won three and drew one. Two of those wins came against Leicester City - a 5-2 Carabao Cup victory and a 3-0 win in the Premier League.

The appointment of [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) led to uncertainty over van Nistelrooy’s future, and it was announced on the new head coach’s first day at the club that he would be leaving. It now seems that [van Nistelrooy is set for a quick return to coaching](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-next-job-30450187).

**READ MORE: [New Man United financial figures highlight major issue INEOS have to solve](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/new-man-united-financial-figures-30457666)**

**READ MORE: [Sir Alex Ferguson made me promise when I joined Man United - he broke it for Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alex-ferguson-liverpool-man-utd-30457621)**

Following the sacking of Steve Cooper, the Dutchman is currently odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester. If it does happen, a reunion withe United will be on the cards in March when they travel to the King Power Stadium.

Van Nistelrooy;s relationship with United could potentially benefit both clubs, especially with the January transfer window not far away. With that in mind, here are four United players that the former coach could potentially sign with his new club.

#### Harry Maguire

The centre-back’s time at United looks to be coming to an end, so could a return to his former club be a possibility? Maguire joined United from Leiceter in the summer of 2019 for a fee of £80 million after two successful seasons at the club, where he also established himself as an England regular.

The 31-year-old has just six months remaining on his contract at Old Trafford. So he can either be sold for a reduced fee in January, or move on for nothing in the summer.

Leicester do have Conor Coady and Jannik Vestergaard as the more experienced centre-back options, but could turn to Maguire if they want to add to their backline.

#### Toby Collyer

The 20-year-old has broken into the squad this season, making an appearance in the second half of the 3-0 defeat against Liverpool back in September. He has however, struggled for appearances since then and has not made the squad in the last seven Premier League games.

A loan move for more game time, and if that could come with a Premier League club like Leicester, then all the better. The Foxes do however have both of their loan slots taken up, it would mean that they would have to either send back or arrange a permanent deal for the two players currently on loan to do another temporary deal.

#### Antony

Antony has failed to live up to his price tag at United since making the move from Ajax in 2022. United paid an initial £82 million fee to bring him to Old Trafford.

It has however been rumoured that they could look to move the winger on in the upcoming transfer window. To do that, it will either have to be for a greatly reduced price, or on a loan deal.

If United could send him on loan to a fellow Premier League club and he refinds his form and confidence. His return would either help him start again at the club, or increase his asking price in the summer window.

#### Ethan Wheatley

Leicester are expected to be on the lookout for another forward in the January window, and that could be the case even more if van Nistelrooy is in charge. If they have a loan slot available, then on possibility could be young United striker Ethan Wheatley.

He has been named in the squad for the Europa League games against Fenerbahce and PAOK, as well as Premier League matches against Liverpool, Southampton, Brentford, West Ham and Chelsea.

The chance to work with van Nistelrooy again as well as getting more Premier League experience could be invaluable for the youngster as he looks to break into the United first team.

Ruud van Nistelrooy could help Manchester United complete four transfers amid new job talk
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United transfer news and opinion as the former striker is the bookmakers odds-on favourite for the vacant Leicester City job.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   19:30, 26 NOV 2024
*   Updated19:34, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruud van Nistelrooy during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD4 match between Manchester United and PAOK FC at Old Trafford.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30458094.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United-v-PAOK-FC-UEFA-Europa-League-202425-League-Phase-MD4.jpg)

Ruud van Nisterooy is odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester City following his exit from Manchester United. (Image: Naomi Baker/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

There has been a lot of talk over the future of [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) since his [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) exit just a couple of weeks ago.

The former striker returned to United in the summer as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The manager’s sacking in October led to van Nistelrooy taking interim charge of the club.

In his four games in charge, United won three and drew one. Two of those wins came against Leicester City - a 5-2 Carabao Cup victory and a 3-0 win in the Premier League.

The appointment of [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) led to uncertainty over van Nistelrooy’s future, and it was announced on the new head coach’s first day at the club that he would be leaving. It now seems that [van Nistelrooy is set for a quick return to coaching](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-next-job-30450187).

**READ MORE: [New Man United financial figures highlight major issue INEOS have to solve](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/new-man-united-financial-figures-30457666)**

**READ MORE: [Sir Alex Ferguson made me promise when I joined Man United - he broke it for Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alex-ferguson-liverpool-man-utd-30457621)**

Following the sacking of Steve Cooper, the Dutchman is currently odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester. If it does happen, a reunion withe United will be on the cards in March when they travel to the King Power Stadium.

Van Nistelrooy;s relationship with United could potentially benefit both clubs, especially with the January transfer window not far away. With that in mind, here are four United players that the former coach could potentially sign with his new club.

#### Harry Maguire

The centre-back’s time at United looks to be coming to an end, so could a return to his former club be a possibility? Maguire joined United from Leiceter in the summer of 2019 for a fee of £80 million after two successful seasons at the club, where he also established himself as an England regular.

The 31-year-old has just six months remaining on his contract at Old Trafford. So he can either be sold for a reduced fee in January, or move on for nothing in the summer.

Leicester do have Conor Coady and Jannik Vestergaard as the more experienced centre-back options, but could turn to Maguire if they want to add to their backline.

#### Toby Collyer

The 20-year-old has broken into the squad this season, making an appearance in the second half of the 3-0 defeat against Liverpool back in September. He has however, struggled for appearances since then and has not made the squad in the last seven Premier League games.

A loan move for more game time, and if that could come with a Premier League club like Leicester, then all the better. The Foxes do however have both of their loan slots taken up, it would mean that they would have to either send back or arrange a permanent deal for the two players currently on loan to do another temporary deal.

#### Antony

Antony has failed to live up to his price tag at United since making the move from Ajax in 2022. United paid an initial £82 million fee to bring him to Old Trafford.

It has however been rumoured that they could look to move the winger on in the upcoming transfer window. To do that, it will either have to be for a greatly reduced price, or on a loan deal.

If United could send him on loan to a fellow Premier League club and he refinds his form and confidence. His return would either help him start again at the club, or increase his asking price in the summer window.

#### Ethan Wheatley

Leicester are expected to be on the lookout for another forward in the January window, and that could be the case even more if van Nistelrooy is in charge. If they have a loan slot available, then on possibility could be young United striker Ethan Wheatley.

He has been named in the squad for the Europa League games against Fenerbahce and PAOK, as well as Premier League matches against Liverpool, Southampton, Brentford, West Ham and Chelsea.

The chance to work with van Nistelrooy again as well as getting more Premier League experience could be invaluable for the youngster as he looks to break into the United first team.

data: {"title":"Van Nistelrooy could help Man United complete four transfers amid new job talk","description":"The latest Manchester United transfer news and opinion as the former striker is the bookmakers odds-on favourite for the vacant Leicester City job.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-could-help-30458046","content":"Ruud van Nistelrooy could help Manchester United complete four transfers amid new job talk - Amie Wilson - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruud van Nistelrooy could help Manchester United complete four transfers amid new job talk
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United transfer news and opinion as the former striker is the bookmakers odds-on favourite for the vacant Leicester City job.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments1](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-could-help-30458046#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   19:30, 26 NOV 2024
*   Updated19:34, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruud van Nistelrooy during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD4 match between Manchester United and PAOK FC at Old Trafford.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30458094.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United-v-PAOK-FC-UEFA-Europa-League-202425-League-Phase-MD4.jpg)

Ruud van Nisterooy is odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester City following his exit from Manchester United. (Image: Naomi Baker/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

There has been a lot of talk over the future of [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) since his [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) exit just a couple of weeks ago.

The former striker returned to United in the summer as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The manager’s sacking in October led to van Nistelrooy taking interim charge of the club.

In his four games in charge, United won three and drew one. Two of those wins came against Leicester City - a 5-2 Carabao Cup victory and a 3-0 win in the Premier League.

The appointment of [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) led to uncertainty over van Nistelrooy’s future, and it was announced on the new head coach’s first day at the club that he would be leaving. It now seems that [van Nistelrooy is set for a quick return to coaching](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-next-job-30450187).

**READ MORE: [New Man United financial figures highlight major issue INEOS have to solve](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/new-man-united-financial-figures-30457666)**

**READ MORE: [Sir Alex Ferguson made me promise when I joined Man United - he broke it for Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alex-ferguson-liverpool-man-utd-30457621)**

Following the sacking of Steve Cooper, the Dutchman is currently odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester. If it does happen, a reunion withe United will be on the cards in March when they travel to the King Power Stadium.

Van Nistelrooy;s relationship with United could potentially benefit both clubs, especially with the January transfer window not far away. With that in mind, here are four United players that the former coach could potentially sign with his new club.

#### Harry Maguire

The centre-back’s time at United looks to be coming to an end, so could a return to his former club be a possibility? Maguire joined United from Leiceter in the summer of 2019 for a fee of £80 million after two successful seasons at the club, where he also established himself as an England regular.

The 31-year-old has just six months remaining on his contract at Old Trafford. So he can either be sold for a reduced fee in January, or move on for nothing in the summer.

Leicester do have Conor Coady and Jannik Vestergaard as the more experienced centre-back options, but could turn to Maguire if they want to add to their backline.

#### Toby Collyer

The 20-year-old has broken into the squad this season, making an appearance in the second half of the 3-0 defeat against Liverpool back in September. He has however, struggled for appearances since then and has not made the squad in the last seven Premier League games.

A loan move for more game time, and if that could come with a Premier League club like Leicester, then all the better. The Foxes do however have both of their loan slots taken up, it would mean that they would have to either send back or arrange a permanent deal for the two players currently on loan to do another temporary deal.

#### Antony

Antony has failed to live up to his price tag at United since making the move from Ajax in 2022. United paid an initial £82 million fee to bring him to Old Trafford.

It has however been rumoured that they could look to move the winger on in the upcoming transfer window. To do that, it will either have to be for a greatly reduced price, or on a loan deal.

If United could send him on loan to a fellow Premier League club and he refinds his form and confidence. His return would either help him start again at the club, or increase his asking price in the summer window.

#### Ethan Wheatley

Leicester are expected to be on the lookout for another forward in the January window, and that could be the case even more if van Nistelrooy is in charge. If they have a loan slot available, then on possibility could be young United striker Ethan Wheatley.

He has been named in the squad for the Europa League games against Fenerbahce and PAOK, as well as Premier League matches against Liverpool, Southampton, Brentford, West Ham and Chelsea.

The chance to work with van Nistelrooy again as well as getting more Premier League experience could be invaluable for the youngster as he looks to break into the United first team.

There has been a lot of talk over the future of [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) since his [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) exit just a couple of weeks ago.

The former striker returned to United in the summer as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The manager’s sacking in October led to van Nistelrooy taking interim charge of the club.

In his four games in charge, United won three and drew one. Two of those wins came against Leicester City - a 5-2 Carabao Cup victory and a 3-0 win in the Premier League.

The appointment of [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) led to uncertainty over van Nistelrooy’s future, and it was announced on the new head coach’s first day at the club that he would be leaving. It now seems that [van Nistelrooy is set for a quick return to coaching](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-next-job-30450187).

**READ MORE: [New Man United financial figures highlight major issue INEOS have to solve](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/new-man-united-financial-figures-30457666)**

**READ MORE: [Sir Alex Ferguson made me promise when I joined Man United - he broke it for Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alex-ferguson-liverpool-man-utd-30457621)**

Following the sacking of Steve Cooper, the Dutchman is currently odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester. If it does happen, a reunion withe United will be on the cards in March when they travel to the King Power Stadium.

Van Nistelrooy;s relationship with United could potentially benefit both clubs, especially with the January transfer window not far away. With that in mind, here are four United players that the former coach could potentially sign with his new club.

#### Harry Maguire

The centre-back’s time at United looks to be coming to an end, so could a return to his former club be a possibility? Maguire joined United from Leiceter in the summer of 2019 for a fee of £80 million after two successful seasons at the club, where he also established himself as an England regular.

The 31-year-old has just six months remaining on his contract at Old Trafford. So he can either be sold for a reduced fee in January, or move on for nothing in the summer.

Leicester do have Conor Coady and Jannik Vestergaard as the more experienced centre-back options, but could turn to Maguire if they want to add to their backline.

#### Toby Collyer

The 20-year-old has broken into the squad this season, making an appearance in the second half of the 3-0 defeat against Liverpool back in September. He has however, struggled for appearances since then and has not made the squad in the last seven Premier League games.

A loan move for more game time, and if that could come with a Premier League club like Leicester, then all the better. The Foxes do however have both of their loan slots taken up, it would mean that they would have to either send back or arrange a permanent deal for the two players currently on loan to do another temporary deal.

#### Antony

Antony has failed to live up to his price tag at United since making the move from Ajax in 2022. United paid an initial £82 million fee to bring him to Old Trafford.

It has however been rumoured that they could look to move the winger on in the upcoming transfer window. To do that, it will either have to be for a greatly reduced price, or on a loan deal.

If United could send him on loan to a fellow Premier League club and he refinds his form and confidence. His return would either help him start again at the club, or increase his asking price in the summer window.

#### Ethan Wheatley

Leicester are expected to be on the lookout for another forward in the January window, and that could be the case even more if van Nistelrooy is in charge. If they have a loan slot available, then on possibility could be young United striker Ethan Wheatley.

He has been named in the squad for the Europa League games against Fenerbahce and PAOK, as well as Premier League matches against Liverpool, Southampton, Brentford, West Ham and Chelsea.

The chance to work with van Nistelrooy again as well as getting more Premier League experience could be invaluable for the youngster as he looks to break into the United first team.

Ruud van Nistelrooy could help Manchester United complete four transfers amid new job talk
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United transfer news and opinion as the former striker is the bookmakers odds-on favourite for the vacant Leicester City job.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Share

*   19:30, 26 NOV 2024
*   Updated19:34, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruud van Nistelrooy during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD4 match between Manchester United and PAOK FC at Old Trafford.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30458094.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United-v-PAOK-FC-UEFA-Europa-League-202425-League-Phase-MD4.jpg)

Ruud van Nisterooy is odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester City following his exit from Manchester United. (Image: Naomi Baker/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

There has been a lot of talk over the future of [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) since his [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) exit just a couple of weeks ago.

The former striker returned to United in the summer as assistant to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The manager’s sacking in October led to van Nistelrooy taking interim charge of the club.

In his four games in charge, United won three and drew one. Two of those wins came against Leicester City - a 5-2 Carabao Cup victory and a 3-0 win in the Premier League.

The appointment of [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) led to uncertainty over van Nistelrooy’s future, and it was announced on the new head coach’s first day at the club that he would be leaving. It now seems that [van Nistelrooy is set for a quick return to coaching](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-next-job-30450187).

**READ MORE: [New Man United financial figures highlight major issue INEOS have to solve](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/new-man-united-financial-figures-30457666)**

**READ MORE: [Sir Alex Ferguson made me promise when I joined Man United - he broke it for Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alex-ferguson-liverpool-man-utd-30457621)**

Following the sacking of Steve Cooper, the Dutchman is currently odds-on favourite to take over at Leicester. If it does happen, a reunion withe United will be on the cards in March when they travel to the King Power Stadium.

Van Nistelrooy;s relationship with United could potentially benefit both clubs, especially with the January transfer window not far away. With that in mind, here are four United players that the former coach could potentially sign with his new club.

#### Harry Maguire

The centre-back’s time at United looks to be coming to an end, so could a return to his former club be a possibility? Maguire joined United from Leiceter in the summer of 2019 for a fee of £80 million after two successful seasons at the club, where he also established himself as an England regular.

The 31-year-old has just six months remaining on his contract at Old Trafford. So he can either be sold for a reduced fee in January, or move on for nothing in the summer.

Leicester do have Conor Coady and Jannik Vestergaard as the more experienced centre-back options, but could turn to Maguire if they want to add to their backline.

#### Toby Collyer

The 20-year-old has broken into the squad this season, making an appearance in the second half of the 3-0 defeat against Liverpool back in September. He has however, struggled for appearances since then and has not made the squad in the last seven Premier League games.

A loan move for more game time, and if that could come with a Premier League club like Leicester, then all the better. The Foxes do however have both of their loan slots taken up, it would mean that they would have to either send back or arrange a permanent deal for the two players currently on loan to do another temporary deal.

#### Antony

Antony has failed to live up to his price tag at United since making the move from Ajax in 2022. United paid an initial £82 million fee to bring him to Old Trafford.

It has however been rumoured that they could look to move the winger on in the upcoming transfer window. To do that, it will either have to be for a greatly reduced price, or on a loan deal.

If United could send him on loan to a fellow Premier League club and he refinds his form and confidence. His return would either help him start again at the club, or increase his asking price in the summer window.

#### Ethan Wheatley

Leicester are expected to be on the lookout for another forward in the January window, and that could be the case even more if van Nistelrooy is in charge. If they have a loan slot available, then on possibility could be young United striker Ethan Wheatley.

He has been named in the squad for the Europa League games against Fenerbahce and PAOK, as well as Premier League matches against Liverpool, Southampton, Brentford, West Ham and Chelsea.

The chance to work with van Nistelrooy again as well as getting more Premier League experience could be invaluable for the youngster as he looks to break into the United first team.

data: {"title":"Amorim and Man United wildcard January option as Gyokeres alternative emerges","description":"Manchester United reputedly want to sign another striker during the January transfer window, and one seems set to be becoming available at a Premier League rival","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-man-united-wildcard-30457713","content":"Ruben Amorim and Man United wildcard January transfer option as Viktor Gyokeres alternative emerges - Matthew Abbott - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                 

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruben Amorim and Man United wildcard January transfer option as Viktor Gyokeres alternative emerges
===================================================================================================

Manchester United reputedly want to sign another striker during the January transfer window, and one seems set to be becoming available at a Premier League rival
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-man-united-wildcard-30457713#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Matthew Abbott](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/matthew-abbott/)

*   19:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Viktor Gyokeres in action for Sporting CP.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/article30403167.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2183527582.jpg)

Viktor Gyokeres reuniting with Ruben Amorim at Manchester United is a transfer rumour that refuses to go away (Image: JAR Sport Images/NurPhoto via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

An alternative to Viktor Gyokeres is seemingly presenting itself to [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) in time for the [January transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/january-transfer-window).

Before becoming the United boss, [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) effectively ruled out signing the Sweden international after vowing that his new club would not be signing players from his former employers in the new year. However, he stopped short of extending that promise until the [summer transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/summer-transfer-window), when he all but acknowledged the striker would leave Sporting.

There have been claims that United are in the market for a centre-forward in January. Amorim starting [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) over [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) and [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) against Ipswich Town only fuelled that speculation. Fresh reports now suggest someone United have previously shown interest in could be available.

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

**READ MORE:** **[United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)**

_[The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/26/brighton-evan-ferguson-loan-january-transfer-window/)_ claims Brighton and Hove Albion will make Evan Ferguson available on loan during January should their current striking department remain fit and firing. United academy graduate [Danny Welbeck](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/danny-welbeck) is starting ahead of the man 14 years his senior for the Seagulls this season, with Joao Pedro and Georginio Rutter supporting the striker.

All three appear ahead of the Republic of Ireland international in the mind of Brighton head coach Fabian Huerzeler despite Ferguson's desperation to play. They claim that a loan within the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) rather than the [Championship](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/football-league-championship) is the likeliest destination, with [Fulham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/fulham-fc), [Leicester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/leicester-city-fc), [Newcastle United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/newcastle-united-fc) and [West Ham United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/west-ham-united-fc) named as teams struggling in front of goal this season.

United has not scored more than any of those quartets, and it is the club Ferguson was a boyhood fan of. [The Manchester Evening News reported last year](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-utd-transfer-news-today-27696901) that the club were monitoring his progress on the south coast.

Now, over 12 months on, Brighton is said to value their striker at around £60million, which is a fee unlikely to be affordable for United in the new year, but the Seagulls would prefer not to sell. Therefore, a loan move could suit both parties in the short term, with the Reds able to assess the availability of Gyokeres or others for the summer transfer window while reinforcing their frontline for the remainder of this season and presumably playing Ferguson plenty, at least more than Brighton currently are.

data: {"title":"Amorim and Man United wildcard January option as Gyokeres alternative emerges","description":"Manchester United reputedly want to sign another striker during the January transfer window, and one seems set to be becoming available at a Premier League rival","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-man-united-wildcard-30457713","content":"Ruben Amorim and Man United wildcard January transfer option as Viktor Gyokeres alternative emerges - Matthew Abbott - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruben Amorim and Man United wildcard January transfer option as Viktor Gyokeres alternative emerges
===================================================================================================

Manchester United reputedly want to sign another striker during the January transfer window, and one seems set to be becoming available at a Premier League rival
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-man-united-wildcard-30457713#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Matthew Abbott](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/matthew-abbott/)

*   19:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Viktor Gyokeres in action for Sporting CP.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/article30403167.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2183527582.jpg)

Viktor Gyokeres reuniting with Ruben Amorim at Manchester United is a transfer rumour that refuses to go away (Image: JAR Sport Images/NurPhoto via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

An alternative to Viktor Gyokeres is seemingly presenting itself to [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) in time for the [January transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/january-transfer-window).

Before becoming the United boss, [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) effectively ruled out signing the Sweden international after vowing that his new club would not be signing players from his former employers in the new year. However, he stopped short of extending that promise until the [summer transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/summer-transfer-window), when he all but acknowledged the striker would leave Sporting.

There have been claims that United are in the market for a centre-forward in January. Amorim starting [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) over [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) and [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) against Ipswich Town only fuelled that speculation. Fresh reports now suggest someone United have previously shown interest in could be available.

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

**READ MORE:** **[United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)**

_[The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/26/brighton-evan-ferguson-loan-january-transfer-window/)_ claims Brighton and Hove Albion will make Evan Ferguson available on loan during January should their current striking department remain fit and firing. United academy graduate [Danny Welbeck](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/danny-welbeck) is starting ahead of the man 14 years his senior for the Seagulls this season, with Joao Pedro and Georginio Rutter supporting the striker.

All three appear ahead of the Republic of Ireland international in the mind of Brighton head coach Fabian Huerzeler despite Ferguson's desperation to play. They claim that a loan within the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) rather than the [Championship](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/football-league-championship) is the likeliest destination, with [Fulham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/fulham-fc), [Leicester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/leicester-city-fc), [Newcastle United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/newcastle-united-fc) and [West Ham United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/west-ham-united-fc) named as teams struggling in front of goal this season.

United has not scored more than any of those quartets, and it is the club Ferguson was a boyhood fan of. [The Manchester Evening News reported last year](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-utd-transfer-news-today-27696901) that the club were monitoring his progress on the south coast.

Now, over 12 months on, Brighton is said to value their striker at around £60million, which is a fee unlikely to be affordable for United in the new year, but the Seagulls would prefer not to sell. Therefore, a loan move could suit both parties in the short term, with the Reds able to assess the availability of Gyokeres or others for the summer transfer window while reinforcing their frontline for the remainder of this season and presumably playing Ferguson plenty, at least more than Brighton currently are.

An alternative to Viktor Gyokeres is seemingly presenting itself to [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) in time for the [January transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/january-transfer-window).

Before becoming the United boss, [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) effectively ruled out signing the Sweden international after vowing that his new club would not be signing players from his former employers in the new year. However, he stopped short of extending that promise until the [summer transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/summer-transfer-window), when he all but acknowledged the striker would leave Sporting.

There have been claims that United are in the market for a centre-forward in January. Amorim starting [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) over [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) and [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) against Ipswich Town only fuelled that speculation. Fresh reports now suggest someone United have previously shown interest in could be available.

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

**READ MORE:** **[United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)**

_[The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/26/brighton-evan-ferguson-loan-january-transfer-window/)_ claims Brighton and Hove Albion will make Evan Ferguson available on loan during January should their current striking department remain fit and firing. United academy graduate [Danny Welbeck](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/danny-welbeck) is starting ahead of the man 14 years his senior for the Seagulls this season, with Joao Pedro and Georginio Rutter supporting the striker.

All three appear ahead of the Republic of Ireland international in the mind of Brighton head coach Fabian Huerzeler despite Ferguson's desperation to play. They claim that a loan within the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) rather than the [Championship](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/football-league-championship) is the likeliest destination, with [Fulham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/fulham-fc), [Leicester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/leicester-city-fc), [Newcastle United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/newcastle-united-fc) and [West Ham United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/west-ham-united-fc) named as teams struggling in front of goal this season.

United has not scored more than any of those quartets, and it is the club Ferguson was a boyhood fan of. [The Manchester Evening News reported last year](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-utd-transfer-news-today-27696901) that the club were monitoring his progress on the south coast.

Now, over 12 months on, Brighton is said to value their striker at around £60million, which is a fee unlikely to be affordable for United in the new year, but the Seagulls would prefer not to sell. Therefore, a loan move could suit both parties in the short term, with the Reds able to assess the availability of Gyokeres or others for the summer transfer window while reinforcing their frontline for the remainder of this season and presumably playing Ferguson plenty, at least more than Brighton currently are.

data: {"title":"Amorim and Man United wildcard January option as Gyokeres alternative emerges","description":"Manchester United reputedly want to sign another striker during the January transfer window, and one seems set to be becoming available at a Premier League rival","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-man-united-wildcard-30457713","content":"Ruben Amorim and Man United wildcard January transfer option as Viktor Gyokeres alternative emerges - Matthew Abbott - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruben Amorim and Man United wildcard January transfer option as Viktor Gyokeres alternative emerges
===================================================================================================

Manchester United reputedly want to sign another striker during the January transfer window, and one seems set to be becoming available at a Premier League rival
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-man-united-wildcard-30457713#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Matthew Abbott](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/matthew-abbott/)

*   19:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Viktor Gyokeres in action for Sporting CP.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/article30403167.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2183527582.jpg)

Viktor Gyokeres reuniting with Ruben Amorim at Manchester United is a transfer rumour that refuses to go away (Image: JAR Sport Images/NurPhoto via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

An alternative to Viktor Gyokeres is seemingly presenting itself to [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) in time for the [January transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/january-transfer-window).

Before becoming the United boss, [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) effectively ruled out signing the Sweden international after vowing that his new club would not be signing players from his former employers in the new year. However, he stopped short of extending that promise until the [summer transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/summer-transfer-window), when he all but acknowledged the striker would leave Sporting.

There have been claims that United are in the market for a centre-forward in January. Amorim starting [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) over [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) and [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) against Ipswich Town only fuelled that speculation. Fresh reports now suggest someone United have previously shown interest in could be available.

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

**READ MORE:** **[United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)**

_[The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/26/brighton-evan-ferguson-loan-january-transfer-window/)_ claims Brighton and Hove Albion will make Evan Ferguson available on loan during January should their current striking department remain fit and firing. United academy graduate [Danny Welbeck](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/danny-welbeck) is starting ahead of the man 14 years his senior for the Seagulls this season, with Joao Pedro and Georginio Rutter supporting the striker.

All three appear ahead of the Republic of Ireland international in the mind of Brighton head coach Fabian Huerzeler despite Ferguson's desperation to play. They claim that a loan within the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) rather than the [Championship](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/football-league-championship) is the likeliest destination, with [Fulham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/fulham-fc), [Leicester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/leicester-city-fc), [Newcastle United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/newcastle-united-fc) and [West Ham United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/west-ham-united-fc) named as teams struggling in front of goal this season.

United has not scored more than any of those quartets, and it is the club Ferguson was a boyhood fan of. [The Manchester Evening News reported last year](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-utd-transfer-news-today-27696901) that the club were monitoring his progress on the south coast.

Now, over 12 months on, Brighton is said to value their striker at around £60million, which is a fee unlikely to be affordable for United in the new year, but the Seagulls would prefer not to sell. Therefore, a loan move could suit both parties in the short term, with the Reds able to assess the availability of Gyokeres or others for the summer transfer window while reinforcing their frontline for the remainder of this season and presumably playing Ferguson plenty, at least more than Brighton currently are.

Manchester United transfer reunion could unlock Ruben Amorim's dream XI for free
================================================================================

Manchester United continue to be linked with a move for former Reds academy star Angel Gomes

By

Matty Hewitt

*   17:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Lille midfielder Angel Gomes is keen on a return to the Premier League](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30304880.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Angel-Gomes-2.jpg)

Lille midfielder Angel Gomes is keen on a return to the Premier League (Image: Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Manchester United continue to be linked with a move for Lille midfielder [Angel Gomes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/angel-gomes-should-reached-very-29895438), just four years after leaving the club on a free transfer.

The Reds academy graduate became the first player born in the 2000s to play for United after making his debut in May 2017. Gomes was highly rated throughout his time in the [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) youth set-up, going on to make 10 senior appearances before departing the club in 2020 after failing to agree terms over a new deal.

Since then, [his ascent has been remarkable.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-clear-angel-gomes-30440973) It's worth throwing in the caveat that had he not experienced the level of first-team football he has since leaving [Old Trafford,](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) he might not have gone on to become a fully fledged England international.

Gomes' performances with the Three Lions have been impressive and it should come as no surprise to see him [linked with not just United, but a number of other Premier League clubs.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-clear-angel-gomes-30440973) The former Reds youngster was predominantly a number ten during his time at Carrington, but was utilised by Lee Carsley in a deep-lying midfield role on international duty.

**READ MORE:** **[United considering including exciting youngsters in Europa League squad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-considering-including-exciting-30452024)**

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

Also capable of playing on the wing, Gomes would add some much needed versatility to United's current squad, if they were to enter negotiations in January. [Ruben Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) side would be able to hold talks over a reunion for the 24-year-old at the turn of the year [with his contract set to expire with his current club this summer.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-mourinho-gomes-amorim-30439244)

Lille could be tempted to cash in on the midfielder who has one goal and one assist to his name so far this season, before potentially losing him on a free transfer at the end of the campaign. A free transfer would be a huge boost for United and their battle to pass the Premier League's PSR deadline, while also allowing them to invest into other areas of the squad.

During the recent draw with Ipswich, Amorim played [Amad Diallo](https://whttps/www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallowwmanchestereveningnewscouk-all-about-amad-diallo) in an unorthodox wing-back role. United have had their fair share of injuries in recent weeks, so bolstering the squad with a player like Gomes, would allow Diallo to be utilised further forward.

After all, Gomes has played in a deeper role for England and with his current club, arguably having more defensive awareness than Amad who operates better in the final third. That's not taking anything away from the Ivorian who has been one of the bright sparks from an otherwise disappointing campaign to date for United.

Gomes is a signing that makes perfect sense. It would allow Amorim to utilise his preferred 3-4-3 formation which we saw for the first time at Portman Road.

The England international could also add some much needed creativity to the final third, if he were to be utilised as one of the number tens behind the central striker. Gomes finished last season with ten assists in all competitions for Lille and two goals to his name.\]

Though he's not the most clinical in front of goal, the young Englishman is a creator and that's something United are crying out for at present time.

Manchester United transfer reunion could unlock Ruben Amorim's dream XI for free
================================================================================

Manchester United continue to be linked with a move for former Reds academy star Angel Gomes
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments4](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-transfer-reunion-could-30454475#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

Matty Hewitt

*   17:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Lille midfielder Angel Gomes is keen on a return to the Premier League](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30304880.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Angel-Gomes-2.jpg)

Lille midfielder Angel Gomes is keen on a return to the Premier League (Image: Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United continue to be linked with a move for Lille midfielder [Angel Gomes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/angel-gomes-should-reached-very-29895438), just four years after leaving the club on a free transfer.

The Reds academy graduate became the first player born in the 2000s to play for United after making his debut in May 2017. Gomes was highly rated throughout his time in the [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) youth set-up, going on to make 10 senior appearances before departing the club in 2020 after failing to agree terms over a new deal.

Since then, [his ascent has been remarkable.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-clear-angel-gomes-30440973) It's worth throwing in the caveat that had he not experienced the level of first-team football he has since leaving [Old Trafford,](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) he might not have gone on to become a fully fledged England international.

Gomes' performances with the Three Lions have been impressive and it should come as no surprise to see him [linked with not just United, but a number of other Premier League clubs.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-clear-angel-gomes-30440973) The former Reds youngster was predominantly a number ten during his time at Carrington, but was utilised by Lee Carsley in a deep-lying midfield role on international duty.

**READ MORE:** **[United considering including exciting youngsters in Europa League squad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-considering-including-exciting-30452024)**

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

Also capable of playing on the wing, Gomes would add some much needed versatility to United's current squad, if they were to enter negotiations in January. [Ruben Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) side would be able to hold talks over a reunion for the 24-year-old at the turn of the year [with his contract set to expire with his current club this summer.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-mourinho-gomes-amorim-30439244)

Lille could be tempted to cash in on the midfielder who has one goal and one assist to his name so far this season, before potentially losing him on a free transfer at the end of the campaign. A free transfer would be a huge boost for United and their battle to pass the Premier League's PSR deadline, while also allowing them to invest into other areas of the squad.

During the recent draw with Ipswich, Amorim played [Amad Diallo](https://whttps/www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallowwmanchestereveningnewscouk-all-about-amad-diallo) in an unorthodox wing-back role. United have had their fair share of injuries in recent weeks, so bolstering the squad with a player like Gomes, would allow Diallo to be utilised further forward.

After all, Gomes has played in a deeper role for England and with his current club, arguably having more defensive awareness than Amad who operates better in the final third. That's not taking anything away from the Ivorian who has been one of the bright sparks from an otherwise disappointing campaign to date for United.

Gomes is a signing that makes perfect sense. It would allow Amorim to utilise his preferred 3-4-3 formation which we saw for the first time at Portman Road.

The England international could also add some much needed creativity to the final third, if he were to be utilised as one of the number tens behind the central striker. Gomes finished last season with ten assists in all competitions for Lille and two goals to his name.\]

Though he's not the most clinical in front of goal, the young Englishman is a creator and that's something United are crying out for at present time.

data: {"title":"Man United transfer reunion could unlock Ruben Amorim's dream XI for free","description":"Manchester United continue to be linked with a move for former Reds academy star Angel Gomes","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-transfer-reunion-could-30454475","content":"Manchester United transfer reunion could unlock Ruben Amorim's dream XI for free - Matty Hewitt - Manchester Evening News
===============

Manchester United transfer reunion could unlock Ruben Amorim's dream XI for free
================================================================================

Manchester United continue to be linked with a move for former Reds academy star Angel Gomes
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments4](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-transfer-reunion-could-30454475#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

Matty Hewitt

*   17:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Lille midfielder Angel Gomes is keen on a return to the Premier League](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30304880.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Angel-Gomes-2.jpg)

Lille midfielder Angel Gomes is keen on a return to the Premier League (Image: Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United continue to be linked with a move for Lille midfielder [Angel Gomes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/angel-gomes-should-reached-very-29895438), just four years after leaving the club on a free transfer.

The Reds academy graduate became the first player born in the 2000s to play for United after making his debut in May 2017. Gomes was highly rated throughout his time in the [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) youth set-up, going on to make 10 senior appearances before departing the club in 2020 after failing to agree terms over a new deal.

Since then, [his ascent has been remarkable.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-clear-angel-gomes-30440973) It's worth throwing in the caveat that had he not experienced the level of first-team football he has since leaving [Old Trafford,](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) he might not have gone on to become a fully fledged England international.

Gomes' performances with the Three Lions have been impressive and it should come as no surprise to see him [linked with not just United, but a number of other Premier League clubs.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-clear-angel-gomes-30440973) The former Reds youngster was predominantly a number ten during his time at Carrington, but was utilised by Lee Carsley in a deep-lying midfield role on international duty.

**READ MORE:** **[United considering including exciting youngsters in Europa League squad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-considering-including-exciting-30452024)**

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

Also capable of playing on the wing, Gomes would add some much needed versatility to United's current squad, if they were to enter negotiations in January. [Ruben Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) side would be able to hold talks over a reunion for the 24-year-old at the turn of the year [with his contract set to expire with his current club this summer.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-mourinho-gomes-amorim-30439244)

Lille could be tempted to cash in on the midfielder who has one goal and one assist to his name so far this season, before potentially losing him on a free transfer at the end of the campaign. A free transfer would be a huge boost for United and their battle to pass the Premier League's PSR deadline, while also allowing them to invest into other areas of the squad.

During the recent draw with Ipswich, Amorim played [Amad Diallo](https://whttps/www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallowwmanchestereveningnewscouk-all-about-amad-diallo) in an unorthodox wing-back role. United have had their fair share of injuries in recent weeks, so bolstering the squad with a player like Gomes, would allow Diallo to be utilised further forward.

After all, Gomes has played in a deeper role for England and with his current club, arguably having more defensive awareness than Amad who operates better in the final third. That's not taking anything away from the Ivorian who has been one of the bright sparks from an otherwise disappointing campaign to date for United.

Gomes is a signing that makes perfect sense. It would allow Amorim to utilise his preferred 3-4-3 formation which we saw for the first time at Portman Road.

The England international could also add some much needed creativity to the final third, if he were to be utilised as one of the number tens behind the central striker. Gomes finished last season with ten assists in all competitions for Lille and two goals to his name.\]

Though he's not the most clinical in front of goal, the young Englishman is a creator and that's something United are crying out for at present time.

Manchester United transfer reunion could unlock Ruben Amorim's dream XI for free
================================================================================

Manchester United continue to be linked with a move for former Reds academy star Angel Gomes
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Share
