By

Matty Hewitt

*   17:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Lille midfielder Angel Gomes is keen on a return to the Premier League](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30304880.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Angel-Gomes-2.jpg)

Lille midfielder Angel Gomes is keen on a return to the Premier League (Image: Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United continue to be linked with a move for Lille midfielder [Angel Gomes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/angel-gomes-should-reached-very-29895438), just four years after leaving the club on a free transfer.

The Reds academy graduate became the first player born in the 2000s to play for United after making his debut in May 2017. Gomes was highly rated throughout his time in the [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) youth set-up, going on to make 10 senior appearances before departing the club in 2020 after failing to agree terms over a new deal.

Since then, [his ascent has been remarkable.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-clear-angel-gomes-30440973) It's worth throwing in the caveat that had he not experienced the level of first-team football he has since leaving [Old Trafford,](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) he might not have gone on to become a fully fledged England international.

Gomes' performances with the Three Lions have been impressive and it should come as no surprise to see him [linked with not just United, but a number of other Premier League clubs.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-clear-angel-gomes-30440973) The former Reds youngster was predominantly a number ten during his time at Carrington, but was utilised by Lee Carsley in a deep-lying midfield role on international duty.

**READ MORE:** **[United considering including exciting youngsters in Europa League squad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-considering-including-exciting-30452024)**

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

Also capable of playing on the wing, Gomes would add some much needed versatility to United's current squad, if they were to enter negotiations in January. [Ruben Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) side would be able to hold talks over a reunion for the 24-year-old at the turn of the year [with his contract set to expire with his current club this summer.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-mourinho-gomes-amorim-30439244)

Lille could be tempted to cash in on the midfielder who has one goal and one assist to his name so far this season, before potentially losing him on a free transfer at the end of the campaign. A free transfer would be a huge boost for United and their battle to pass the Premier League's PSR deadline, while also allowing them to invest into other areas of the squad.

During the recent draw with Ipswich, Amorim played [Amad Diallo](https://whttps/www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallowwmanchestereveningnewscouk-all-about-amad-diallo) in an unorthodox wing-back role. United have had their fair share of injuries in recent weeks, so bolstering the squad with a player like Gomes, would allow Diallo to be utilised further forward.

After all, Gomes has played in a deeper role for England and with his current club, arguably having more defensive awareness than Amad who operates better in the final third. That's not taking anything away from the Ivorian who has been one of the bright sparks from an otherwise disappointing campaign to date for United.

Gomes is a signing that makes perfect sense. It would allow Amorim to utilise his preferred 3-4-3 formation which we saw for the first time at Portman Road.

The England international could also add some much needed creativity to the final third, if he were to be utilised as one of the number tens behind the central striker. Gomes finished last season with ten assists in all competitions for Lille and two goals to his name.\]

Though he's not the most clinical in front of goal, the young Englishman is a creator and that's something United are crying out for at present time.

Gary Neville spots Man United 'red flags' and issue Ruben Amorim must fix
=========================================================================

Latest Manchester United news and gossip as Gary Neville makes a claim about what Ruben Amorim may need to fix after the draw at Ipswich
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

By

[Mark Wakefield](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/mark-wakefield/)

*   18:30, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Gary Neville has spoke about Manchester United's draw with Ipswich](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30321995.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Gary-Neville-file-photo.jpg)

Gary Neville has spoke about Manchester United's draw with Ipswich (Image: PA)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Gary Neville has explained why Ruben Amorim will be fully aware of the 'red flags' at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

Amorim's reign as United head coach began on Sunday with a 1-1 draw away at Ipswich Town. The stalemate leaves United in 12th place in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) table and will next face Everton in the top flight after taking on Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

Before [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) appointment, United had won just three of their first 10 Premier League matches this season, as well as four defeats. The draw with Ipswich still leaves United in the bottom half of the Premier League table but just six points adrift of the top four spots.

Neville was asked if he spotted any concerns with individual performances from some United players at Portman Road. The United legend explained why Amorim will now have spotted some of the issues that need addressing.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

"The red flags that were there yesterday would have been there probably for the last few months and the last season and a half of a team that are very difficult to actually like watching," Neville said on [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/football/news/29326/13260681/ruben-amorims-man-utd-bow-assessed-gary-neville-runs-though-the-winners-red-flags-and-familiar-failings-after-first-game).

"And I say that with respect because I genuinely do believe what Ruben Amorim said at the end of the game. No football player goes out onto the pitch and wants to lose or doesn't want to win or, work hard or do well.

"They don't want criticism. But you watch them play, even yesterday, the new system, and you look at Ipswich, who are very near the bottom of the league, who look more organized, better coached. They look like they've got more appetite for the game, more enthusiasm.

"And that's a constant and has been a constant, not just obviously on Sunday, but a constant for the last year-and-a-half, two years, three years. So we got to a situation where these group of players, to be honest with you, have created a pattern for themselves and become what they are.

"And not just a red flag yesterday, because the same things that we've seen in the last six to eight months, ten months, we saw yesterday with Ruben Amorim being the manager, he saw it as well.

"He \[Amorim\] obviously knew how big a job this was, but he'll have recognized it yesterday."

Gary Neville spots Man United 'red flags' and issue Ruben Amorim must fix
=========================================================================

Latest Manchester United news and gossip as Gary Neville makes a claim about what Ruben Amorim may need to fix after the draw at Ipswich
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

![Image 1: Gary Neville has spoke about Manchester United's draw with Ipswich](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30321995.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Gary-Neville-file-photo.jpg)

Gary Neville has spoke about Manchester United's draw with Ipswich (Image: PA)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Gary Neville has explained why Ruben Amorim will be fully aware of the 'red flags' at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

Amorim's reign as United head coach began on Sunday with a 1-1 draw away at Ipswich Town. The stalemate leaves United in 12th place in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) table and will next face Everton in the top flight after taking on Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

Before [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) appointment, United had won just three of their first 10 Premier League matches this season, as well as four defeats. The draw with Ipswich still leaves United in the bottom half of the Premier League table but just six points adrift of the top four spots.

Neville was asked if he spotted any concerns with individual performances from some United players at Portman Road. The United legend explained why Amorim will now have spotted some of the issues that need addressing.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

"The red flags that were there yesterday would have been there probably for the last few months and the last season and a half of a team that are very difficult to actually like watching," Neville said on [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/football/news/29326/13260681/ruben-amorims-man-utd-bow-assessed-gary-neville-runs-though-the-winners-red-flags-and-familiar-failings-after-first-game).

"And I say that with respect because I genuinely do believe what Ruben Amorim said at the end of the game. No football player goes out onto the pitch and wants to lose or doesn't want to win or, work hard or do well.

"They don't want criticism. But you watch them play, even yesterday, the new system, and you look at Ipswich, who are very near the bottom of the league, who look more organized, better coached. They look like they've got more appetite for the game, more enthusiasm.

"And that's a constant and has been a constant, not just obviously on Sunday, but a constant for the last year-and-a-half, two years, three years. So we got to a situation where these group of players, to be honest with you, have created a pattern for themselves and become what they are.

"And not just a red flag yesterday, because the same things that we've seen in the last six to eight months, ten months, we saw yesterday with Ruben Amorim being the manager, he saw it as well.

"He \[Amorim\] obviously knew how big a job this was, but he'll have recognized it yesterday."

===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Gary Neville spots Man United 'red flags' and issue Ruben Amorim must fix
=========================================================================

Latest Manchester United news and gossip as Gary Neville makes a claim about what Ruben Amorim may need to fix after the draw at Ipswich
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/gary-neville-spots-man-united-30457486#comments-wrapper "Comments")

By

[Mark Wakefield](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/mark-wakefield/)

*   18:30, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Gary Neville has spoke about Manchester United's draw with Ipswich](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30321995.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Gary-Neville-file-photo.jpg)

Gary Neville has spoke about Manchester United's draw with Ipswich (Image: PA)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Gary Neville has explained why Ruben Amorim will be fully aware of the 'red flags' at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

Amorim's reign as United head coach began on Sunday with a 1-1 draw away at Ipswich Town. The stalemate leaves United in 12th place in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) table and will next face Everton in the top flight after taking on Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

Before [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) appointment, United had won just three of their first 10 Premier League matches this season, as well as four defeats. The draw with Ipswich still leaves United in the bottom half of the Premier League table but just six points adrift of the top four spots.

Neville was asked if he spotted any concerns with individual performances from some United players at Portman Road. The United legend explained why Amorim will now have spotted some of the issues that need addressing.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

"The red flags that were there yesterday would have been there probably for the last few months and the last season and a half of a team that are very difficult to actually like watching," Neville said on [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/football/news/29326/13260681/ruben-amorims-man-utd-bow-assessed-gary-neville-runs-though-the-winners-red-flags-and-familiar-failings-after-first-game).

"And I say that with respect because I genuinely do believe what Ruben Amorim said at the end of the game. No football player goes out onto the pitch and wants to lose or doesn't want to win or, work hard or do well.

"They don't want criticism. But you watch them play, even yesterday, the new system, and you look at Ipswich, who are very near the bottom of the league, who look more organized, better coached. They look like they've got more appetite for the game, more enthusiasm.

"And that's a constant and has been a constant, not just obviously on Sunday, but a constant for the last year-and-a-half, two years, three years. So we got to a situation where these group of players, to be honest with you, have created a pattern for themselves and become what they are.

"And not just a red flag yesterday, because the same things that we've seen in the last six to eight months, ten months, we saw yesterday with Ruben Amorim being the manager, he saw it as well.

"He \[Amorim\] obviously knew how big a job this was, but he'll have recognized it yesterday."

===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Gary Neville spots Man United 'red flags' and issue Ruben Amorim must fix
=========================================================================

Latest Manchester United news and gossip as Gary Neville makes a claim about what Ruben Amorim may need to fix after the draw at Ipswich
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/gary-neville-spots-man-united-30457486#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Mark Wakefield](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/mark-wakefield/)

*   18:30, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Gary Neville has spoke about Manchester United's draw with Ipswich](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30321995.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Gary-Neville-file-photo.jpg)

Gary Neville has spoke about Manchester United's draw with Ipswich (Image: PA)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Gary Neville has explained why Ruben Amorim will be fully aware of the 'red flags' at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

Amorim's reign as United head coach began on Sunday with a 1-1 draw away at Ipswich Town. The stalemate leaves United in 12th place in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) table and will next face Everton in the top flight after taking on Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

Before [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) appointment, United had won just three of their first 10 Premier League matches this season, as well as four defeats. The draw with Ipswich still leaves United in the bottom half of the Premier League table but just six points adrift of the top four spots.

Neville was asked if he spotted any concerns with individual performances from some United players at Portman Road. The United legend explained why Amorim will now have spotted some of the issues that need addressing.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

"The red flags that were there yesterday would have been there probably for the last few months and the last season and a half of a team that are very difficult to actually like watching," Neville said on [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/football/news/29326/13260681/ruben-amorims-man-utd-bow-assessed-gary-neville-runs-though-the-winners-red-flags-and-familiar-failings-after-first-game).

"And I say that with respect because I genuinely do believe what Ruben Amorim said at the end of the game. No football player goes out onto the pitch and wants to lose or doesn't want to win or, work hard or do well.

"They don't want criticism. But you watch them play, even yesterday, the new system, and you look at Ipswich, who are very near the bottom of the league, who look more organized, better coached. They look like they've got more appetite for the game, more enthusiasm.

"And that's a constant and has been a constant, not just obviously on Sunday, but a constant for the last year-and-a-half, two years, three years. So we got to a situation where these group of players, to be honest with you, have created a pattern for themselves and become what they are.

"And not just a red flag yesterday, because the same things that we've seen in the last six to eight months, ten months, we saw yesterday with Ruben Amorim being the manager, he saw it as well.

"He \[Amorim\] obviously knew how big a job this was, but he'll have recognized it yesterday."

Gary Neville spots Man United 'red flags' and issue Ruben Amorim must fix
=========================================================================

Latest Manchester United news and gossip as Gary Neville makes a claim about what Ruben Amorim may need to fix after the draw at Ipswich
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![Image 1: Gary Neville has spoke about Manchester United's draw with Ipswich](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30321995.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Gary-Neville-file-photo.jpg)

Gary Neville has spoke about Manchester United's draw with Ipswich (Image: PA)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Gary Neville has explained why Ruben Amorim will be fully aware of the 'red flags' at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

Amorim's reign as United head coach began on Sunday with a 1-1 draw away at Ipswich Town. The stalemate leaves United in 12th place in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) table and will next face Everton in the top flight after taking on Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

Before [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) appointment, United had won just three of their first 10 Premier League matches this season, as well as four defeats. The draw with Ipswich still leaves United in the bottom half of the Premier League table but just six points adrift of the top four spots.

Neville was asked if he spotted any concerns with individual performances from some United players at Portman Road. The United legend explained why Amorim will now have spotted some of the issues that need addressing.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

"The red flags that were there yesterday would have been there probably for the last few months and the last season and a half of a team that are very difficult to actually like watching," Neville said on [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/football/news/29326/13260681/ruben-amorims-man-utd-bow-assessed-gary-neville-runs-though-the-winners-red-flags-and-familiar-failings-after-first-game).

"And I say that with respect because I genuinely do believe what Ruben Amorim said at the end of the game. No football player goes out onto the pitch and wants to lose or doesn't want to win or, work hard or do well.

"They don't want criticism. But you watch them play, even yesterday, the new system, and you look at Ipswich, who are very near the bottom of the league, who look more organized, better coached. They look like they've got more appetite for the game, more enthusiasm.

"And that's a constant and has been a constant, not just obviously on Sunday, but a constant for the last year-and-a-half, two years, three years. So we got to a situation where these group of players, to be honest with you, have created a pattern for themselves and become what they are.

"And not just a red flag yesterday, because the same things that we've seen in the last six to eight months, ten months, we saw yesterday with Ruben Amorim being the manager, he saw it as well.

"He \[Amorim\] obviously knew how big a job this was, but he'll have recognized it yesterday."

Man United icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after 'big' win
====================================================================================

Elon Musk congratulated former Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr won their fourth consecutive AFC Champions League match
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

[Matthew Abbott](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/matthew-abbott/)

*   18:15, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Cristiano Ronaldo during an Al-Nassr match](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30458125.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186821038.jpg)

Cristiano Ronaldo has engaged with Elon Musk on his social media platform X (Image: Yasser Bakhsh/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Elon Musk congratulated Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr's latest win in the AFC [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) Elite, and the former [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) player has now responded.

[Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo), 39, scored twice for the Saudi Pro League side as they beat Qatar Stars League side Al Gharafa away in Al Rayyan. Former [Newcastle United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/newcastle-united-fc) and [Stoke City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/stoke-city-fc) striker Joselu, who spent last season on loan at Real Madrid, scored a consolation for the hosts after the brace and a goal from the one-time [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) winger Angelo Gabriel.

Ronaldo shared a photo of himself and the latter doing his _Siu_ celebration during the match on the social media platform Musk owns, X, formerly [Twitter](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/twitter), afterwards. Eight minutes after posting, "Big win tonight!" Musk replied.

"Congrats!" the businessman wrote, to which Ronaldo eventually responded approaching 20 hours later: "@elonmusk … Glad your eyes have time for good “soccer”"

He punctuated that response with a grinning face emoji and a flexed biceps emoji. The original post has over 68 million views, and Ronaldo has almost 114 million followers on the website, some 100 million less than Musk's 206 million.

The win comes three days after Al Nassr lost for the first time in the Saudi Pro League this season at home to Al Qadisiyah. Despite taking the lead through Ronaldo, the Mexico international Julian Quinones equalised before former [Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/arsenal-fc) captain Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored what proved to be the winning goal.

Al Nassr has won just one of its last five domestic matches. They also drew with Al Hilal and Al Kholood and were knocked out of the King Cup of Champions by Al Taawoun.

However, they have now qualified for the Champions League knockout stages with three games to spare. They sit second in the West Region table - all three Saudi sides occupy the top three places.

data: {"title":"Man Utd icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after win","description":"Elon Musk congratulated former Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr won their fourth consecutive AFC Champions League match","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-icon-cristiano-ronaldo-30458152","content":"Man United icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after 'big' win - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Man United icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after 'big' win
====================================================================================

Elon Musk congratulated former Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr won their fourth consecutive AFC Champions League match
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-icon-cristiano-ronaldo-30458152#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Matthew Abbott](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/matthew-abbott/)

*   18:15, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Cristiano Ronaldo during an Al-Nassr match](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30458125.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186821038.jpg)

Cristiano Ronaldo has engaged with Elon Musk on his social media platform X (Image: Yasser Bakhsh/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Elon Musk congratulated Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr's latest win in the AFC [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) Elite, and the former [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) player has now responded.

[Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo), 39, scored twice for the Saudi Pro League side as they beat Qatar Stars League side Al Gharafa away in Al Rayyan. Former [Newcastle United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/newcastle-united-fc) and [Stoke City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/stoke-city-fc) striker Joselu, who spent last season on loan at Real Madrid, scored a consolation for the hosts after the brace and a goal from the one-time [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) winger Angelo Gabriel.

Ronaldo shared a photo of himself and the latter doing his _Siu_ celebration during the match on the social media platform Musk owns, X, formerly [Twitter](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/twitter), afterwards. Eight minutes after posting, "Big win tonight!" Musk replied.

"Congrats!" the businessman wrote, to which Ronaldo eventually responded approaching 20 hours later: "@elonmusk … Glad your eyes have time for good “soccer”"

> [@elonmusk](https://twitter.com/elonmusk?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) … Glad your eyes have time for good “soccer”
> 
> — Cristiano Ronaldo (@Cristiano) [November 26, 2024](https://twitter.com/Cristiano/status/1861444000638472559?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

He punctuated that response with a grinning face emoji and a flexed biceps emoji. The original post has over 68 million views, and Ronaldo has almost 114 million followers on the website, some 100 million less than Musk's 206 million.

The win comes three days after Al Nassr lost for the first time in the Saudi Pro League this season at home to Al Qadisiyah. Despite taking the lead through Ronaldo, the Mexico international Julian Quinones equalised before former [Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/arsenal-fc) captain Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored what proved to be the winning goal.

Al Nassr has won just one of its last five domestic matches. They also drew with Al Hilal and Al Kholood and were knocked out of the King Cup of Champions by Al Taawoun.

However, they have now qualified for the Champions League knockout stages with three games to spare. They sit second in the West Region table - all three Saudi sides occupy the top three places.

data: {"title":"Man Utd icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after win","description":"Elon Musk congratulated former Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr won their fourth consecutive AFC Champions League match","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-icon-cristiano-ronaldo-30458152","content":"Man United icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after 'big' win - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Man United icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after 'big' win
====================================================================================

Elon Musk congratulated former Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr won their fourth consecutive AFC Champions League match
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-icon-cristiano-ronaldo-30458152#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Matthew Abbott](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/matthew-abbott/)

*   18:15, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Cristiano Ronaldo during an Al-Nassr match](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30458125.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186821038.jpg)

Cristiano Ronaldo has engaged with Elon Musk on his social media platform X (Image: Yasser Bakhsh/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Elon Musk congratulated Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr's latest win in the AFC [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) Elite, and the former [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) player has now responded.

[Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo), 39, scored twice for the Saudi Pro League side as they beat Qatar Stars League side Al Gharafa away in Al Rayyan. Former [Newcastle United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/newcastle-united-fc) and [Stoke City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/stoke-city-fc) striker Joselu, who spent last season on loan at Real Madrid, scored a consolation for the hosts after the brace and a goal from the one-time [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) winger Angelo Gabriel.

Ronaldo shared a photo of himself and the latter doing his _Siu_ celebration during the match on the social media platform Musk owns, X, formerly [Twitter](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/twitter), afterwards. Eight minutes after posting, "Big win tonight!" Musk replied.

"Congrats!" the businessman wrote, to which Ronaldo eventually responded approaching 20 hours later: "@elonmusk … Glad your eyes have time for good “soccer”"

> [@elonmusk](https://twitter.com/elonmusk?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) … Glad your eyes have time for good “soccer”
> 
> — Cristiano Ronaldo (@Cristiano) [November 26, 2024](https://twitter.com/Cristiano/status/1861444000638472559?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

He punctuated that response with a grinning face emoji and a flexed biceps emoji. The original post has over 68 million views, and Ronaldo has almost 114 million followers on the website, some 100 million less than Musk's 206 million.

The win comes three days after Al Nassr lost for the first time in the Saudi Pro League this season at home to Al Qadisiyah. Despite taking the lead through Ronaldo, the Mexico international Julian Quinones equalised before former [Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/arsenal-fc) captain Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored what proved to be the winning goal.

Al Nassr has won just one of its last five domestic matches. They also drew with Al Hilal and Al Kholood and were knocked out of the King Cup of Champions by Al Taawoun.

However, they have now qualified for the Champions League knockout stages with three games to spare. They sit second in the West Region table - all three Saudi sides occupy the top three places.

data: {"title":"Man Utd icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after win","description":"Elon Musk congratulated former Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr won their fourth consecutive AFC Champions League match","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-icon-cristiano-ronaldo-30458152","content":"Man United icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after 'big' win - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Man United icon Cristiano Ronaldo sends Elon Musk eight-word message after 'big' win
====================================================================================

Elon Musk congratulated former Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr won their fourth consecutive AFC Champions League match
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-icon-cristiano-ronaldo-30458152#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Matthew Abbott](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/matthew-abbott/)

*   18:15, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Cristiano Ronaldo during an Al-Nassr match](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30458125.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186821038.jpg)

Cristiano Ronaldo has engaged with Elon Musk on his social media platform X (Image: Yasser Bakhsh/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Elon Musk congratulated Cristiano Ronaldo after Al Nassr's latest win in the AFC [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) Elite, and the former [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) player has now responded.

[Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo), 39, scored twice for the Saudi Pro League side as they beat Qatar Stars League side Al Gharafa away in Al Rayyan. Former [Newcastle United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/newcastle-united-fc) and [Stoke City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/stoke-city-fc) striker Joselu, who spent last season on loan at Real Madrid, scored a consolation for the hosts after the brace and a goal from the one-time [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) winger Angelo Gabriel.

Ronaldo shared a photo of himself and the latter doing his _Siu_ celebration during the match on the social media platform Musk owns, X, formerly [Twitter](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/twitter), afterwards. Eight minutes after posting, "Big win tonight!" Musk replied.

"Congrats!" the businessman wrote, to which Ronaldo eventually responded approaching 20 hours later: "@elonmusk … Glad your eyes have time for good “soccer”"

He punctuated that response with a grinning face emoji and a flexed biceps emoji. The original post has over 68 million views, and Ronaldo has almost 114 million followers on the website, some 100 million less than Musk's 206 million.

The win comes three days after Al Nassr lost for the first time in the Saudi Pro League this season at home to Al Qadisiyah. Despite taking the lead through Ronaldo, the Mexico international Julian Quinones equalised before former [Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/arsenal-fc) captain Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored what proved to be the winning goal.

Al Nassr has won just one of its last five domestic matches. They also drew with Al Hilal and Al Kholood and were knocked out of the King Cup of Champions by Al Taawoun.

However, they have now qualified for the Champions League knockout stages with three games to spare. They sit second in the West Region table - all three Saudi sides occupy the top three places.

Manchester United dealt Euro blow as they face UEFA Youth League challenge
==========================================================================

Man United's youngsters were beaten 2-1 by AZ Alkmaar in the UEFA Youth League on Tuesday evening.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Manchester United's Under-19s were beaten 2-1 by AZ Alkmaar in the first leg of their UEFA Youth League third round tie in the Netherlands on Tuesday.

Adam Lawrence's side, who blitzed past FK Zalgiris in the previous round, winning 11-2 on aggregate, got their noses in front with 19 minutes on the clock at the AZ Training Centre when AZ defender Jeremiah Esajas turned the ball into his own net. [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), who included the likes of [Harry Amass](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/harry-amass) and Ethan Wheatley in their starting line-up, were pegged back just before half-time when 18-year-old Yoel van den Ban clawed the home side level.

The Dutch outfit, who won the UEFA Youth League in 2022/23, turned the contest on its head with just over 20 minutes left when Kasper Boogaard found the net.

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

**READ MORE:** **[United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)**

United boss Lawrence turned to his substitutes bench in the hope of finding an answer that would enable his side to find a route back into the game. He brought on striker Gabriele Biancheri, who has been scoring for fun so far this season, and Amir Ibragimov, but his efforts were to no avail, meaning United lost for just the second time this season in all competitions at Under-18s/Under-19s level.

Summer signing Chido Obi-Martin was named in the matchday squad for a Youth League fixture for the first time this season but he failed to make it off the bench.

United will get the chance to try and flip the tie on its head when the two sides meet again in the second leg at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on December 10. The winner of the tie will progress to the UEFA Youth League's full knockout stages, where the teams meet from the 'Domestic Champions path', in which United are currently competing in, and the 'UEFA [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) path'.

===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Manchester United dealt Euro blow as they face UEFA Youth League challenge
==========================================================================

Man United's youngsters were beaten 2-1 by AZ Alkmaar in the UEFA Youth League on Tuesday evening.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-dealt-euro-blow-30458176#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   18:12, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United's players celebrate after their goal against AZ Alkmaar.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30458181.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186992501.jpg)

Manchester United's youngsters were edged out by AZ Alkmaar. (Image: Manchester United/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United's Under-19s were beaten 2-1 by AZ Alkmaar in the first leg of their UEFA Youth League third round tie in the Netherlands on Tuesday.

Adam Lawrence's side, who blitzed past FK Zalgiris in the previous round, winning 11-2 on aggregate, got their noses in front with 19 minutes on the clock at the AZ Training Centre when AZ defender Jeremiah Esajas turned the ball into his own net. [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), who included the likes of [Harry Amass](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/harry-amass) and Ethan Wheatley in their starting line-up, were pegged back just before half-time when 18-year-old Yoel van den Ban clawed the home side level.

The Dutch outfit, who won the UEFA Youth League in 2022/23, turned the contest on its head with just over 20 minutes left when Kasper Boogaard found the net.

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

**READ MORE:** **[United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)**

United boss Lawrence turned to his substitutes bench in the hope of finding an answer that would enable his side to find a route back into the game. He brought on striker Gabriele Biancheri, who has been scoring for fun so far this season, and Amir Ibragimov, but his efforts were to no avail, meaning United lost for just the second time this season in all competitions at Under-18s/Under-19s level.

Summer signing Chido Obi-Martin was named in the matchday squad for a Youth League fixture for the first time this season but he failed to make it off the bench.

United will get the chance to try and flip the tie on its head when the two sides meet again in the second leg at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on December 10. The winner of the tie will progress to the UEFA Youth League's full knockout stages, where the teams meet from the 'Domestic Champions path', in which United are currently competing in, and the 'UEFA [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) path'.

data: {"title":"Man United dealt Euro blow as they face UEFA Youth League challenge","description":"Man United's youngsters were beaten 2-1 by AZ Alkmaar in the UEFA Youth League on Tuesday evening.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-dealt-euro-blow-30458176","content":"Manchester United dealt Euro blow as they face UEFA Youth League challenge - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Manchester United dealt Euro blow as they face UEFA Youth League challenge
==========================================================================

Man United's youngsters were beaten 2-1 by AZ Alkmaar in the UEFA Youth League on Tuesday evening.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-dealt-euro-blow-30458176#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   18:12, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United's players celebrate after their goal against AZ Alkmaar.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30458181.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186992501.jpg)

Manchester United's youngsters were edged out by AZ Alkmaar. (Image: Manchester United/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United's Under-19s were beaten 2-1 by AZ Alkmaar in the first leg of their UEFA Youth League third round tie in the Netherlands on Tuesday.

Adam Lawrence's side, who blitzed past FK Zalgiris in the previous round, winning 11-2 on aggregate, got their noses in front with 19 minutes on the clock at the AZ Training Centre when AZ defender Jeremiah Esajas turned the ball into his own net. [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), who included the likes of [Harry Amass](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/harry-amass) and Ethan Wheatley in their starting line-up, were pegged back just before half-time when 18-year-old Yoel van den Ban clawed the home side level.

The Dutch outfit, who won the UEFA Youth League in 2022/23, turned the contest on its head with just over 20 minutes left when Kasper Boogaard found the net.

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

**READ MORE:** **[United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)**

United boss Lawrence turned to his substitutes bench in the hope of finding an answer that would enable his side to find a route back into the game. He brought on striker Gabriele Biancheri, who has been scoring for fun so far this season, and Amir Ibragimov, but his efforts were to no avail, meaning United lost for just the second time this season in all competitions at Under-18s/Under-19s level.

Summer signing Chido Obi-Martin was named in the matchday squad for a Youth League fixture for the first time this season but he failed to make it off the bench.

United will get the chance to try and flip the tie on its head when the two sides meet again in the second leg at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on December 10. The winner of the tie will progress to the UEFA Youth League's full knockout stages, where the teams meet from the 'Domestic Champions path', in which United are currently competing in, and the 'UEFA [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) path'.

Manchester United's youngsters were edged out by AZ Alkmaar. (Image: Manchester United/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Manchester United's Under-19s were beaten 2-1 by AZ Alkmaar in the first leg of their UEFA Youth League third round tie in the Netherlands on Tuesday.

Adam Lawrence's side, who blitzed past FK Zalgiris in the previous round, winning 11-2 on aggregate, got their noses in front with 19 minutes on the clock at the AZ Training Centre when AZ defender Jeremiah Esajas turned the ball into his own net. [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), who included the likes of [Harry Amass](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/harry-amass) and Ethan Wheatley in their starting line-up, were pegged back just before half-time when 18-year-old Yoel van den Ban clawed the home side level.

The Dutch outfit, who won the UEFA Youth League in 2022/23, turned the contest on its head with just over 20 minutes left when Kasper Boogaard found the net.

**READ MORE:** **[United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)**

United boss Lawrence turned to his substitutes bench in the hope of finding an answer that would enable his side to find a route back into the game. He brought on striker Gabriele Biancheri, who has been scoring for fun so far this season, and Amir Ibragimov, but his efforts were to no avail, meaning United lost for just the second time this season in all competitions at Under-18s/Under-19s level.

Summer signing Chido Obi-Martin was named in the matchday squad for a Youth League fixture for the first time this season but he failed to make it off the bench.

United will get the chance to try and flip the tie on its head when the two sides meet again in the second leg at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on December 10. The winner of the tie will progress to the UEFA Youth League's full knockout stages, where the teams meet from the 'Domestic Champions path', in which United are currently competing in, and the 'UEFA [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) path'.

===============
                                 

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Manchester United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed
====================================================================================

Leny Yoro is getting closer to making his competitive debut for Man Utd and he will get plenty of opportunities in Ruben Amorim's back three.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Tyrone Marshall](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article15426084.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_tyrone-marshall.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Tyrone Marshall](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/tyrone-marshall/)Senior Football Writer

*   05:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Noussair Mazraoui and Liam Delap](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article30448779.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186656129.jpg)

Noussair Mazraoui squares up to Liam Delap during United's draw at Ipswich

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Noussair Mazraoui might only have been a Manchester United player for 18 games, but he has already played four different positions for his new club, having been handed a new role for Ruben Amorim's first game in charge.

The Morrocan's versatility in covering both full-back positions was attractive when United paid Bayern Munich £12.8m, with a further £4.2m in add-ons, to sign him this summer. With [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) still yet to field a natural left-back this season, Mazraoui has had to fill in on both flanks, with 12 of his appearances at right-back and three on the left.

There was widespread surprise when Erik ten Hag fielded him as an attacking midfielder at Fenerbahce in the Europa League, an experiment unlikely to be repeated under [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim), even if he does like to operate with two players in that area of the pitch. That didn't stop the Portuguese from giving him a new position though, starting him as the right-sided central defender in his 3-4-3 system at Ipswich.

**ALSO READ: ['Be amazed' - Amorim has proven United critic wrong once and could do so again](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/be-amazed-ruben-amorim-proven-30446457)**

**ALSO READ: [Manchester United can start their Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

There had been a lot of speculation about [Mazraoui's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/noussair-mazraoui) potential role under Amorim and whether he had the attributes to play at wing-back. In the end, Diogo Dalot and Amad started. But with Leny Yoro, Lisandro Martinez and Harry Maguire all absent, there was a role for Mazraoui.

The 27-year-old impressed again and further solidified his reputation as a fan favourite. It was only his fifth career start at centre-back, but he defended superbly and was comfortable on the ball. He played a role in the build-up to the first goal by taking possession from Andre Onana and then finding a pass up the right flank that allowed Bruno Fernandes and Amad to combine.

Once again, it was his physicality that most caught the eye. He won 11 duels in the game, the most by an individual in the Premier League this season and six more than any of his United teammates. He loves a battle and often comes out on top, so while Liam Delap tried to bully United's defence, he didn't get much success against Mazraoui.

With Yoro closing in on a return and Martinez and Maguire not far away, Mazraoui's stint as a centre-back could be a short one. Amorim's best back three will surely be Yoro, Martinez and Matthijs de Ligt.

But the new head coach might have to find a role for Mazraoui somewhere. He has already complained about this squad's lack of running back and physicality. Mazraoui's relish of the battle and his own physical strengths could make him important as something of a tone-setter.

Amorim was certainly impressed with him at Ipswich. “We don’t have too many centre-backs so we have to adapt some players. I thought Noussair Mazraoui did very well," he said. "He is so smart and is so important for us. He can play anywhere and that kind of player is crucial for our future."

Mazraoui could soon be operating in a fifth position this season if he gets a chance in one of the wing-back roles. He is close to undroppable at the moment because of the influence he can have on his teammates.

data: {"title":"Man United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed","description":"Leny Yoro is getting closer to making his competitive debut for Man Utd and he will get plenty of opportunities in Ruben Amorim's back three.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761","content":"Manchester United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed - Tyrone Marshall - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Manchester United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed
====================================================================================

Leny Yoro is getting closer to making his competitive debut for Man Utd and he will get plenty of opportunities in Ruben Amorim's back three.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments5](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Tyrone Marshall](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article15426084.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_tyrone-marshall.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Tyrone Marshall](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/tyrone-marshall/)Senior Football Writer

*   05:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Noussair Mazraoui and Liam Delap](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article30448779.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186656129.jpg)

Noussair Mazraoui squares up to Liam Delap during United's draw at Ipswich

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Noussair Mazraoui might only have been a Manchester United player for 18 games, but he has already played four different positions for his new club, having been handed a new role for Ruben Amorim's first game in charge.

The Morrocan's versatility in covering both full-back positions was attractive when United paid Bayern Munich £12.8m, with a further £4.2m in add-ons, to sign him this summer. With [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) still yet to field a natural left-back this season, Mazraoui has had to fill in on both flanks, with 12 of his appearances at right-back and three on the left.

There was widespread surprise when Erik ten Hag fielded him as an attacking midfielder at Fenerbahce in the Europa League, an experiment unlikely to be repeated under [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim), even if he does like to operate with two players in that area of the pitch. That didn't stop the Portuguese from giving him a new position though, starting him as the right-sided central defender in his 3-4-3 system at Ipswich.

**ALSO READ: ['Be amazed' - Amorim has proven United critic wrong once and could do so again](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/be-amazed-ruben-amorim-proven-30446457)**

**ALSO READ: [Manchester United can start their Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

There had been a lot of speculation about [Mazraoui's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/noussair-mazraoui) potential role under Amorim and whether he had the attributes to play at wing-back. In the end, Diogo Dalot and Amad started. But with Leny Yoro, Lisandro Martinez and Harry Maguire all absent, there was a role for Mazraoui.

The 27-year-old impressed again and further solidified his reputation as a fan favourite. It was only his fifth career start at centre-back, but he defended superbly and was comfortable on the ball. He played a role in the build-up to the first goal by taking possession from Andre Onana and then finding a pass up the right flank that allowed Bruno Fernandes and Amad to combine.

Once again, it was his physicality that most caught the eye. He won 11 duels in the game, the most by an individual in the Premier League this season and six more than any of his United teammates. He loves a battle and often comes out on top, so while Liam Delap tried to bully United's defence, he didn't get much success against Mazraoui.

With Yoro closing in on a return and Martinez and Maguire not far away, Mazraoui's stint as a centre-back could be a short one. Amorim's best back three will surely be Yoro, Martinez and Matthijs de Ligt.

But the new head coach might have to find a role for Mazraoui somewhere. He has already complained about this squad's lack of running back and physicality. Mazraoui's relish of the battle and his own physical strengths could make him important as something of a tone-setter.

Amorim was certainly impressed with him at Ipswich. “We don’t have too many centre-backs so we have to adapt some players. I thought Noussair Mazraoui did very well," he said. "He is so smart and is so important for us. He can play anywhere and that kind of player is crucial for our future."

Mazraoui could soon be operating in a fifth position this season if he gets a chance in one of the wing-back roles. He is close to undroppable at the moment because of the influence he can have on his teammates.

===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Manchester United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed
====================================================================================

Leny Yoro is getting closer to making his competitive debut for Man Utd and he will get plenty of opportunities in Ruben Amorim's back three.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments5](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Tyrone Marshall](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article15426084.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_tyrone-marshall.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Tyrone Marshall](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/tyrone-marshall/)Senior Football Writer

*   05:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Noussair Mazraoui and Liam Delap](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article30448779.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186656129.jpg)

Noussair Mazraoui squares up to Liam Delap during United's draw at Ipswich

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Noussair Mazraoui might only have been a Manchester United player for 18 games, but he has already played four different positions for his new club, having been handed a new role for Ruben Amorim's first game in charge.

The Morrocan's versatility in covering both full-back positions was attractive when United paid Bayern Munich £12.8m, with a further £4.2m in add-ons, to sign him this summer. With [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) still yet to field a natural left-back this season, Mazraoui has had to fill in on both flanks, with 12 of his appearances at right-back and three on the left.

There was widespread surprise when Erik ten Hag fielded him as an attacking midfielder at Fenerbahce in the Europa League, an experiment unlikely to be repeated under [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim), even if he does like to operate with two players in that area of the pitch. That didn't stop the Portuguese from giving him a new position though, starting him as the right-sided central defender in his 3-4-3 system at Ipswich.

**ALSO READ: ['Be amazed' - Amorim has proven United critic wrong once and could do so again](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/be-amazed-ruben-amorim-proven-30446457)**

**ALSO READ: [Manchester United can start their Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

There had been a lot of speculation about [Mazraoui's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/noussair-mazraoui) potential role under Amorim and whether he had the attributes to play at wing-back. In the end, Diogo Dalot and Amad started. But with Leny Yoro, Lisandro Martinez and Harry Maguire all absent, there was a role for Mazraoui.

The 27-year-old impressed again and further solidified his reputation as a fan favourite. It was only his fifth career start at centre-back, but he defended superbly and was comfortable on the ball. He played a role in the build-up to the first goal by taking possession from Andre Onana and then finding a pass up the right flank that allowed Bruno Fernandes and Amad to combine.

Once again, it was his physicality that most caught the eye. He won 11 duels in the game, the most by an individual in the Premier League this season and six more than any of his United teammates. He loves a battle and often comes out on top, so while Liam Delap tried to bully United's defence, he didn't get much success against Mazraoui.

With Yoro closing in on a return and Martinez and Maguire not far away, Mazraoui's stint as a centre-back could be a short one. Amorim's best back three will surely be Yoro, Martinez and Matthijs de Ligt.

But the new head coach might have to find a role for Mazraoui somewhere. He has already complained about this squad's lack of running back and physicality. Mazraoui's relish of the battle and his own physical strengths could make him important as something of a tone-setter.

Amorim was certainly impressed with him at Ipswich. “We don’t have too many centre-backs so we have to adapt some players. I thought Noussair Mazraoui did very well," he said. "He is so smart and is so important for us. He can play anywhere and that kind of player is crucial for our future."

Mazraoui could soon be operating in a fifth position this season if he gets a chance in one of the wing-back roles. He is close to undroppable at the moment because of the influence he can have on his teammates.
