data: {"title":"Man United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed","description":"Leny Yoro is getting closer to making his competitive debut for Man Utd and he will get plenty of opportunities in Ruben Amorim's back three.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761","content":"Manchester United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed - Tyrone Marshall - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Manchester United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed
====================================================================================

Leny Yoro is getting closer to making his competitive debut for Man Utd and he will get plenty of opportunities in Ruben Amorim's back three.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments5](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Tyrone Marshall](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article15426084.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_tyrone-marshall.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Tyrone Marshall](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/tyrone-marshall/)Senior Football Writer

*   05:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Noussair Mazraoui and Liam Delap](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article30448779.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186656129.jpg)

Noussair Mazraoui squares up to Liam Delap during United's draw at Ipswich

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Noussair Mazraoui might only have been a Manchester United player for 18 games, but he has already played four different positions for his new club, having been handed a new role for Ruben Amorim's first game in charge.

The Morrocan's versatility in covering both full-back positions was attractive when United paid Bayern Munich £12.8m, with a further £4.2m in add-ons, to sign him this summer. With [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) still yet to field a natural left-back this season, Mazraoui has had to fill in on both flanks, with 12 of his appearances at right-back and three on the left.

There was widespread surprise when Erik ten Hag fielded him as an attacking midfielder at Fenerbahce in the Europa League, an experiment unlikely to be repeated under [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim), even if he does like to operate with two players in that area of the pitch. That didn't stop the Portuguese from giving him a new position though, starting him as the right-sided central defender in his 3-4-3 system at Ipswich.

**ALSO READ: ['Be amazed' - Amorim has proven United critic wrong once and could do so again](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/be-amazed-ruben-amorim-proven-30446457)**

**ALSO READ: [Manchester United can start their Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

There had been a lot of speculation about [Mazraoui's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/noussair-mazraoui) potential role under Amorim and whether he had the attributes to play at wing-back. In the end, Diogo Dalot and Amad started. But with Leny Yoro, Lisandro Martinez and Harry Maguire all absent, there was a role for Mazraoui.

The 27-year-old impressed again and further solidified his reputation as a fan favourite. It was only his fifth career start at centre-back, but he defended superbly and was comfortable on the ball. He played a role in the build-up to the first goal by taking possession from Andre Onana and then finding a pass up the right flank that allowed Bruno Fernandes and Amad to combine.

Once again, it was his physicality that most caught the eye. He won 11 duels in the game, the most by an individual in the Premier League this season and six more than any of his United teammates. He loves a battle and often comes out on top, so while Liam Delap tried to bully United's defence, he didn't get much success against Mazraoui.

With Yoro closing in on a return and Martinez and Maguire not far away, Mazraoui's stint as a centre-back could be a short one. Amorim's best back three will surely be Yoro, Martinez and Matthijs de Ligt.

But the new head coach might have to find a role for Mazraoui somewhere. He has already complained about this squad's lack of running back and physicality. Mazraoui's relish of the battle and his own physical strengths could make him important as something of a tone-setter.

Amorim was certainly impressed with him at Ipswich. “We don’t have too many centre-backs so we have to adapt some players. I thought Noussair Mazraoui did very well," he said. "He is so smart and is so important for us. He can play anywhere and that kind of player is crucial for our future."

Mazraoui could soon be operating in a fifth position this season if he gets a chance in one of the wing-back roles. He is close to undroppable at the moment because of the influence he can have on his teammates.

Kobbie Mainoo gets shock Man United warning as Ruben Amorim tipped to complete transfer
=======================================================================================

Ruben Amorim would certainly rock the boat at Manchester United if Danny Murphy's radical transfer prediction comes to fruition
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![Image 1: Kobbie Mainoo has recently returned from injury for Manchester United](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30453220.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/1_GettyImages-2175683513.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo has recently returned from injury for Manchester United (Image: Visionhaus/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Kobbie Mainoo has been warned that Ruben Amorim could sign a new midfielder ahead of the January transfer window. The 19-year-old midfielder, who's yet to play for the new [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) boss, has [missed the last six matches due to a muscle injury](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ive-never-forgotten-manchester-united-30451660) he suffered last month.

Mainoo was replaced by Casemiro in the final minutes of the goalless draw with Aston Villa in October, having [aggravated the hamstring problem he picked up against Tottenham Hotspur](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/amad-mainoo-shaw-manchester-united-30328902) a week prior. Ruud van Nistelrooy, who has since stepped down as interim manager, later confirmed that the teenager wouldn't be available until after the November international break.

"Kobbie is also progressing with his injury. He isn't yet with the team, though. He needs more time," said the Dutchman. Mainoo finally returned to the matchday squad that faced Ipswich Town at the weekend, but [he was an unused substitute](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-willing-hand-paul-30452417).

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on United's three weaknesses with new warm-up drills](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE:** [**Amad improved something in only three days of training under Amorim**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)

Ruben Amorim opted to bring on Manuel Ugarte instead, [further delaying the Englishman's audition for a place in the starting line-up](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414). In a column for [BBC Sport](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/c1e71wvgp96o), former [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) and England midfielder Danny Murphy claimed that the switch at Portman Road could be a sign of things to come, although Mainoo was returning from injury.

The ex-[Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) ace suggested that Mainoo may not have a future at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), and tipped Amorim to bring in a new face to partner Ugarte in the middle of the park. Murphy said: "To play that role well, United's midfielders will need to be more than just mobile, too.

"They will both have to love the defensive side of the game and be able to spot danger and then be fast enough to stop it. In the long run, I think Manuel Ugarte will be one of them.

"He needs a run of games to get his sharpness back, but we have seen glimpses of how good he is, for example, in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) against Fenerbahce last month, and he has flourished under Amorim at Sporting before."

Murphy added: "As for who Ugarte will have alongside him, well, it will probably be someone who is not at the club at the moment. There is going to have to be activity in the next couple of transfer windows for them to get the type of player Amorim requires."

While Murphy surprisingly overlooked Mainoo, [Gary Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville) branded the teenager as a 'certainty' in Amorim's side. The United legend said: "I think Mainoo and Ugarte for me, playing midfield, I think they’re absolute certs."

Kobbie Mainoo gets shock Man United warning as Ruben Amorim tipped to complete transfer
=======================================================================================

Ruben Amorim would certainly rock the boat at Manchester United if Danny Murphy's radical transfer prediction comes to fruition
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/kobbie-mainoo-gets-shock-man-30451524#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jake Stokes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jake-stokes/)

*   11:19, 26 NOV 2024
*   Updated11:23, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Kobbie Mainoo has recently returned from injury for Manchester United](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30453220.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/1_GettyImages-2175683513.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo has recently returned from injury for Manchester United (Image: Visionhaus/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Kobbie Mainoo has been warned that Ruben Amorim could sign a new midfielder ahead of the January transfer window. The 19-year-old midfielder, who's yet to play for the new [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) boss, has [missed the last six matches due to a muscle injury](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ive-never-forgotten-manchester-united-30451660) he suffered last month.

Mainoo was replaced by Casemiro in the final minutes of the goalless draw with Aston Villa in October, having [aggravated the hamstring problem he picked up against Tottenham Hotspur](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/amad-mainoo-shaw-manchester-united-30328902) a week prior. Ruud van Nistelrooy, who has since stepped down as interim manager, later confirmed that the teenager wouldn't be available until after the November international break.

"Kobbie is also progressing with his injury. He isn't yet with the team, though. He needs more time," said the Dutchman. Mainoo finally returned to the matchday squad that faced Ipswich Town at the weekend, but [he was an unused substitute](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-willing-hand-paul-30452417).

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on United's three weaknesses with new warm-up drills](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE:** [**Amad improved something in only three days of training under Amorim**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)

Ruben Amorim opted to bring on Manuel Ugarte instead, [further delaying the Englishman's audition for a place in the starting line-up](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414). In a column for [BBC Sport](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/c1e71wvgp96o), former [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) and England midfielder Danny Murphy claimed that the switch at Portman Road could be a sign of things to come, although Mainoo was returning from injury.

The ex-[Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) ace suggested that Mainoo may not have a future at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), and tipped Amorim to bring in a new face to partner Ugarte in the middle of the park. Murphy said: "To play that role well, United's midfielders will need to be more than just mobile, too.

"They will both have to love the defensive side of the game and be able to spot danger and then be fast enough to stop it. In the long run, I think Manuel Ugarte will be one of them.

"He needs a run of games to get his sharpness back, but we have seen glimpses of how good he is, for example, in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) against Fenerbahce last month, and he has flourished under Amorim at Sporting before."

Murphy added: "As for who Ugarte will have alongside him, well, it will probably be someone who is not at the club at the moment. There is going to have to be activity in the next couple of transfer windows for them to get the type of player Amorim requires."

While Murphy surprisingly overlooked Mainoo, [Gary Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville) branded the teenager as a 'certainty' in Amorim's side. The United legend said: "I think Mainoo and Ugarte for me, playing midfield, I think they’re absolute certs."

data: {"title":"Mainoo gets shock Man United warning as Amorim tipped to complete transfer","description":"Ruben Amorim would certainly rock the boat at Manchester United if Danny Murphy's radical transfer prediction comes to fruition","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/kobbie-mainoo-gets-shock-man-30451524","content":"Kobbie Mainoo gets shock Man United warning as Ruben Amorim tipped to complete transfer - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Kobbie Mainoo gets shock Man United warning as Ruben Amorim tipped to complete transfer
=======================================================================================

Ruben Amorim would certainly rock the boat at Manchester United if Danny Murphy's radical transfer prediction comes to fruition
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/kobbie-mainoo-gets-shock-man-30451524#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jake Stokes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jake-stokes/)

*   11:19, 26 NOV 2024
*   Updated11:23, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Kobbie Mainoo has recently returned from injury for Manchester United](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30453220.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/1_GettyImages-2175683513.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo has recently returned from injury for Manchester United (Image: Visionhaus/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Kobbie Mainoo has been warned that Ruben Amorim could sign a new midfielder ahead of the January transfer window. The 19-year-old midfielder, who's yet to play for the new [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) boss, has [missed the last six matches due to a muscle injury](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ive-never-forgotten-manchester-united-30451660) he suffered last month.

Mainoo was replaced by Casemiro in the final minutes of the goalless draw with Aston Villa in October, having [aggravated the hamstring problem he picked up against Tottenham Hotspur](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/amad-mainoo-shaw-manchester-united-30328902) a week prior. Ruud van Nistelrooy, who has since stepped down as interim manager, later confirmed that the teenager wouldn't be available until after the November international break.

"Kobbie is also progressing with his injury. He isn't yet with the team, though. He needs more time," said the Dutchman. Mainoo finally returned to the matchday squad that faced Ipswich Town at the weekend, but [he was an unused substitute](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-willing-hand-paul-30452417).

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on United's three weaknesses with new warm-up drills](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE:** [**Amad improved something in only three days of training under Amorim**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)

Ruben Amorim opted to bring on Manuel Ugarte instead, [further delaying the Englishman's audition for a place in the starting line-up](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414). In a column for [BBC Sport](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/c1e71wvgp96o), former [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) and England midfielder Danny Murphy claimed that the switch at Portman Road could be a sign of things to come, although Mainoo was returning from injury.

The ex-[Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) ace suggested that Mainoo may not have a future at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), and tipped Amorim to bring in a new face to partner Ugarte in the middle of the park. Murphy said: "To play that role well, United's midfielders will need to be more than just mobile, too.

"They will both have to love the defensive side of the game and be able to spot danger and then be fast enough to stop it. In the long run, I think Manuel Ugarte will be one of them.

"He needs a run of games to get his sharpness back, but we have seen glimpses of how good he is, for example, in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) against Fenerbahce last month, and he has flourished under Amorim at Sporting before."

Murphy added: "As for who Ugarte will have alongside him, well, it will probably be someone who is not at the club at the moment. There is going to have to be activity in the next couple of transfer windows for them to get the type of player Amorim requires."

While Murphy surprisingly overlooked Mainoo, [Gary Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville) branded the teenager as a 'certainty' in Amorim's side. The United legend said: "I think Mainoo and Ugarte for me, playing midfield, I think they’re absolute certs."

data: {"title":"Mainoo gets shock Man United warning as Amorim tipped to complete transfer","description":"Ruben Amorim would certainly rock the boat at Manchester United if Danny Murphy's radical transfer prediction comes to fruition","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/kobbie-mainoo-gets-shock-man-30451524","content":"Kobbie Mainoo gets shock Man United warning as Ruben Amorim tipped to complete transfer - Manchester Evening News

Kobbie Mainoo gets shock Man United warning as Ruben Amorim tipped to complete transfer
=======================================================================================

Ruben Amorim would certainly rock the boat at Manchester United if Danny Murphy's radical transfer prediction comes to fruition
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/kobbie-mainoo-gets-shock-man-30451524#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jake Stokes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jake-stokes/)

*   11:19, 26 NOV 2024
*   Updated11:23, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Kobbie Mainoo has recently returned from injury for Manchester United](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30453220.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/1_GettyImages-2175683513.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo has recently returned from injury for Manchester United (Image: Visionhaus/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Kobbie Mainoo has been warned that Ruben Amorim could sign a new midfielder ahead of the January transfer window. The 19-year-old midfielder, who's yet to play for the new [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) boss, has [missed the last six matches due to a muscle injury](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ive-never-forgotten-manchester-united-30451660) he suffered last month.

Mainoo was replaced by Casemiro in the final minutes of the goalless draw with Aston Villa in October, having [aggravated the hamstring problem he picked up against Tottenham Hotspur](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/amad-mainoo-shaw-manchester-united-30328902) a week prior. Ruud van Nistelrooy, who has since stepped down as interim manager, later confirmed that the teenager wouldn't be available until after the November international break.

"Kobbie is also progressing with his injury. He isn't yet with the team, though. He needs more time," said the Dutchman. Mainoo finally returned to the matchday squad that faced Ipswich Town at the weekend, but [he was an unused substitute](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-willing-hand-paul-30452417).

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on United's three weaknesses with new warm-up drills](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE:** [**Amad improved something in only three days of training under Amorim**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)

Ruben Amorim opted to bring on Manuel Ugarte instead, [further delaying the Englishman's audition for a place in the starting line-up](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414). In a column for [BBC Sport](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/c1e71wvgp96o), former [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) and England midfielder Danny Murphy claimed that the switch at Portman Road could be a sign of things to come, although Mainoo was returning from injury.

The ex-[Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) ace suggested that Mainoo may not have a future at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), and tipped Amorim to bring in a new face to partner Ugarte in the middle of the park. Murphy said: "To play that role well, United's midfielders will need to be more than just mobile, too.

"They will both have to love the defensive side of the game and be able to spot danger and then be fast enough to stop it. In the long run, I think Manuel Ugarte will be one of them.

"He needs a run of games to get his sharpness back, but we have seen glimpses of how good he is, for example, in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) against Fenerbahce last month, and he has flourished under Amorim at Sporting before."

Murphy added: "As for who Ugarte will have alongside him, well, it will probably be someone who is not at the club at the moment. There is going to have to be activity in the next couple of transfer windows for them to get the type of player Amorim requires."

While Murphy surprisingly overlooked Mainoo, [Gary Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville) branded the teenager as a 'certainty' in Amorim's side. The United legend said: "I think Mainoo and Ugarte for me, playing midfield, I think they’re absolute certs."

'Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four Manchester United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim
================================================================================================

Gary Neville is confident certain players will thrive under new Man United head coach Ruben Amorim.

Gary Neville believes Luke Shaw is a "certainty" to become a key figure under Ruben Amorim, insisting those who are "adaptable" will blossom under the new [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach.

The England international made his long-awaited comeback from injury in Sunday's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town at Portman Road, stepping off the bench 11 minutes into the second half.

It marked his first appearance of any kind since England's 2-1 defeat to Spain in the European Championship final in July and his first in United colours since February.

**READ MORE:** **[United make Chido Obi-Martin decision ahead of European fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-make-chido-obi-30451403)**

**READ MORE:** **[United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

He slotted into the left-sided centre-back berth after replacing [Jonny Evans](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jonny-evans). United were light on centre-back options at Portman Road, missing Leny Yoro, [Lisandro Martinez](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/lisandro-martinez) and Harry Maguire.

Amorim, as expected, deployed a 3-4-3 formation, meaning he will need to be able to rely on his centre-backs to fill those three spaces in defence. And for [Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville), he believes Shaw and Yoro could be among the biggest winners of his appointment, likewise midfield duo Manuel Ugarte and [Kobbie Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo), neither of whom started on Sunday.

"Luke Shaw, if he can keep fit \[will be a winner\]," said Neville, speaking to Sky Sports. "As I think that left centre-back needs to eventually be able to play out as a left-back, so he is well suited to do both. The same must be said of the right centre-back.

"We saw \[Noussair\] Mazraoui do it against Ipswich. I think Ugarte will be a winner, just because I think in midfield, not just because he's played for him before.

"I think it's how you fit in the likes of \[Marcus\] Rashford, \[Alejandro\] Garnacho, Bruno Fernandes. Because one thing you know with that system, you've got two wing-backs, you've got a back-three and you've got a two in front.

"It's then that three, which obviously the two that he likes to play sort of come inside a little bit. So, you're wondering about sort of Amad... Amad played obviously wide yesterday, but Garnacho, Rashford, \[Rasmus\] Hojlund, \[Joshua\] Zirkzee, Fernandes. That's the conundrum of those attacking positions where I can't quite see what's going to happen.

"I think Mainoo and Ugarte for me, playing midfield, I think they're absolute certs. I think Luke Shaw's a certainty to play. I think he would be anyway in a back four or a back three.

"I think ultimately you'll end up with Yoro as the right-centre-back, I think just because of that energy and that pace. So, I think the winners will be the ones who I think are adaptable."

'Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four Manchester United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim
================================================================================================

Gary Neville is confident certain players will thrive under new Man United head coach Ruben Amorim.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Gary Neville appears on Sky Sports from his home via a video call.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30452529.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Screenshot-2024-11-26-at-102150.png)

Gary Neville has picked the bones out of Ruben Amorim's first game in charge. (Image: Sky Sports.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Gary Neville believes Luke Shaw is a "certainty" to become a key figure under Ruben Amorim, insisting those who are "adaptable" will blossom under the new [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach.

The England international made his long-awaited comeback from injury in Sunday's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town at Portman Road, stepping off the bench 11 minutes into the second half.

It marked his first appearance of any kind since England's 2-1 defeat to Spain in the European Championship final in July and his first in United colours since February.

**READ MORE:** **[United make Chido Obi-Martin decision ahead of European fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-make-chido-obi-30451403)**

**READ MORE:** **[United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

He slotted into the left-sided centre-back berth after replacing [Jonny Evans](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jonny-evans). United were light on centre-back options at Portman Road, missing Leny Yoro, [Lisandro Martinez](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/lisandro-martinez) and Harry Maguire.

Amorim, as expected, deployed a 3-4-3 formation, meaning he will need to be able to rely on his centre-backs to fill those three spaces in defence. And for [Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville), he believes Shaw and Yoro could be among the biggest winners of his appointment, likewise midfield duo Manuel Ugarte and [Kobbie Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo), neither of whom started on Sunday.

"Luke Shaw, if he can keep fit \[will be a winner\]," said Neville, speaking to Sky Sports. "As I think that left centre-back needs to eventually be able to play out as a left-back, so he is well suited to do both. The same must be said of the right centre-back.

"We saw \[Noussair\] Mazraoui do it against Ipswich. I think Ugarte will be a winner, just because I think in midfield, not just because he's played for him before.

"I think it's how you fit in the likes of \[Marcus\] Rashford, \[Alejandro\] Garnacho, Bruno Fernandes. Because one thing you know with that system, you've got two wing-backs, you've got a back-three and you've got a two in front.

"It's then that three, which obviously the two that he likes to play sort of come inside a little bit. So, you're wondering about sort of Amad... Amad played obviously wide yesterday, but Garnacho, Rashford, \[Rasmus\] Hojlund, \[Joshua\] Zirkzee, Fernandes. That's the conundrum of those attacking positions where I can't quite see what's going to happen.

"I think Mainoo and Ugarte for me, playing midfield, I think they're absolute certs. I think Luke Shaw's a certainty to play. I think he would be anyway in a back four or a back three.

"I think ultimately you'll end up with Yoro as the right-centre-back, I think just because of that energy and that pace. So, I think the winners will be the ones who I think are adaptable."

'Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four Manchester United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim
================================================================================================

Gary Neville is confident certain players will thrive under new Man United head coach Ruben Amorim.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Gary Neville appears on Sky Sports from his home via a video call.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30452529.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Screenshot-2024-11-26-at-102150.png)

Gary Neville has picked the bones out of Ruben Amorim's first game in charge. (Image: Sky Sports.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Gary Neville believes Luke Shaw is a "certainty" to become a key figure under Ruben Amorim, insisting those who are "adaptable" will blossom under the new [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach.

The England international made his long-awaited comeback from injury in Sunday's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town at Portman Road, stepping off the bench 11 minutes into the second half.

It marked his first appearance of any kind since England's 2-1 defeat to Spain in the European Championship final in July and his first in United colours since February.

**READ MORE:** **[United make Chido Obi-Martin decision ahead of European fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-make-chido-obi-30451403)**

**READ MORE:** **[United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

He slotted into the left-sided centre-back berth after replacing [Jonny Evans](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jonny-evans). United were light on centre-back options at Portman Road, missing Leny Yoro, [Lisandro Martinez](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/lisandro-martinez) and Harry Maguire.

Amorim, as expected, deployed a 3-4-3 formation, meaning he will need to be able to rely on his centre-backs to fill those three spaces in defence. And for [Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville), he believes Shaw and Yoro could be among the biggest winners of his appointment, likewise midfield duo Manuel Ugarte and [Kobbie Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo), neither of whom started on Sunday.

"Luke Shaw, if he can keep fit \[will be a winner\]," said Neville, speaking to Sky Sports. "As I think that left centre-back needs to eventually be able to play out as a left-back, so he is well suited to do both. The same must be said of the right centre-back.

"We saw \[Noussair\] Mazraoui do it against Ipswich. I think Ugarte will be a winner, just because I think in midfield, not just because he's played for him before.

"I think it's how you fit in the likes of \[Marcus\] Rashford, \[Alejandro\] Garnacho, Bruno Fernandes. Because one thing you know with that system, you've got two wing-backs, you've got a back-three and you've got a two in front.

"It's then that three, which obviously the two that he likes to play sort of come inside a little bit. So, you're wondering about sort of Amad... Amad played obviously wide yesterday, but Garnacho, Rashford, \[Rasmus\] Hojlund, \[Joshua\] Zirkzee, Fernandes. That's the conundrum of those attacking positions where I can't quite see what's going to happen.

"I think Mainoo and Ugarte for me, playing midfield, I think they're absolute certs. I think Luke Shaw's a certainty to play. I think he would be anyway in a back four or a back three.

"I think ultimately you'll end up with Yoro as the right-centre-back, I think just because of that energy and that pace. So, I think the winners will be the ones who I think are adaptable."

'Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four Manchester United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim
================================================================================================

Gary Neville is confident certain players will thrive under new Man United head coach Ruben Amorim.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Gary Neville appears on Sky Sports from his home via a video call.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30452529.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Screenshot-2024-11-26-at-102150.png)

Gary Neville has picked the bones out of Ruben Amorim's first game in charge. (Image: Sky Sports.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Gary Neville believes Luke Shaw is a "certainty" to become a key figure under Ruben Amorim, insisting those who are "adaptable" will blossom under the new [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) head coach.

The England international made his long-awaited comeback from injury in Sunday's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town at Portman Road, stepping off the bench 11 minutes into the second half.

He slotted into the left-sided centre-back berth after replacing [Jonny Evans](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jonny-evans). United were light on centre-back options at Portman Road, missing Leny Yoro, [Lisandro Martinez](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/lisandro-martinez) and Harry Maguire.

Amorim, as expected, deployed a 3-4-3 formation, meaning he will need to be able to rely on his centre-backs to fill those three spaces in defence. And for [Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville), he believes Shaw and Yoro could be among the biggest winners of his appointment, likewise midfield duo Manuel Ugarte and [Kobbie Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo), neither of whom started on Sunday.

"Luke Shaw, if he can keep fit \[will be a winner\]," said Neville, speaking to Sky Sports. "As I think that left centre-back needs to eventually be able to play out as a left-back, so he is well suited to do both. The same must be said of the right centre-back.

"We saw \[Noussair\] Mazraoui do it against Ipswich. I think Ugarte will be a winner, just because I think in midfield, not just because he's played for him before.

"I think it's how you fit in the likes of \[Marcus\] Rashford, \[Alejandro\] Garnacho, Bruno Fernandes. Because one thing you know with that system, you've got two wing-backs, you've got a back-three and you've got a two in front.

"It's then that three, which obviously the two that he likes to play sort of come inside a little bit. So, you're wondering about sort of Amad... Amad played obviously wide yesterday, but Garnacho, Rashford, \[Rasmus\] Hojlund, \[Joshua\] Zirkzee, Fernandes. That's the conundrum of those attacking positions where I can't quite see what's going to happen.

"I think Mainoo and Ugarte for me, playing midfield, I think they're absolute certs. I think Luke Shaw's a certainty to play. I think he would be anyway in a back four or a back three.

"I think ultimately you'll end up with Yoro as the right-centre-back, I think just because of that energy and that pace. So, I think the winners will be the ones who I think are adaptable."

Former Man United coach who slammed Erik ten Hag sends Aaron Wan-Bissaka message after landmark
===============================================================================================

Former Manchester United defender Aaron Wan-Bissaka opened his account for West Ham after leaving Old Trafford in the summer
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Stephen Killen](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/stephen-killen/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:30, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: West Ham defender Aaron Wan-Bissaka.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30452144.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186879231.jpg)

Former Manchester United players and coaches sent Aaron Wan-Bissaka a message after his goal for West Ham. (Image: Photo by Stu Forster/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Former Manchester United striker Anthony Martial and ex-goalkeeper David de Gea joined Benni McCarthy in heaping praise on Aaron Wan-Bissaka after opening his West Ham United account.

The Hammers picked up an important win beating Newcastle United 2-0 at St James' Park. Tomas Soucek opened the scoring after 10 minutes before the former United defender doubled the East London side's lead to alleviate some of the pressure building on under fire manager Julen Lopetegui.

West Ham moved six points clear of the bottom three and further away from the likes of Wolves - who picked up an important win away at Fulham - as well as Everton and Leicester City. Wan-Bissaka completed a move back to the capital, following a five-year spell at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), signing for West Ham on a seven-year contract for an undisclosed fee.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

**READ MORE: ['I've never forgotten' - Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana shows his true colours](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ive-never-forgotten-manchester-united-30451660)**

And after 11 [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) outings, the 27-year-old scored his first goal for the Hammers and on Instagram, he wrote: "First in claret & blue. We keep pushing."

Former United teammates Martial, De Gea and Teden Mengi were among those to send support to the full-back. Both Martial and De Gea posted spider emojis while the now-Luton Town defender Mengi added: "Yessirrrrr."

There was also a compliment from former United coach Benni McCarthy. The former Blackburn Rovers striker, who left his role at the Theatre of Dreams in the summer, said: "Nice one Wan B. Well played mate and good goal."

Erik ten Hag wanted to keep McCarthy in the United ranks following his one-year extension in light of the [FA Cup](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/fa-cup) triumph over [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc). The South African opted to part ways and in an interview following his exit, while he praised the Dutchman highly, he noted that the tactician was lacking two key managerial components.

"Tactically Erik is one of the smartest coaches I have ever met. He is intelligent, a very intelligent man," he told Portuguese outlet [Zero Zero](https://www.zerozero.pt/noticias/benni-mccarthy-heroi-portista-separacao-entre-ronaldo-e-ten-hag-era-inevitavel-/682502#google_vignette). "Meticulous, concerned with details.

"He made everything available to the players, he carefully explained every possible and imaginable situation about the game. Then, at the end of the day, it was up to the players to step onto the pitch and give a good response

"In modern football, I believe that players want to see a bit more passion in their coach. They need to feel that the coach is with them and willing to fight alongside them. Tactically, I feel that Erik is at the top. He lacks a bit of that fire, that passion. That’s where we differ, him and I.

"Sometimes I didn’t see in him that passion I speak of. He has a different personality, a different profile. I think that was one of the difficulties that the team and the players encountered."

data: {"title":"Ex-Man Utd coach who slammed Ten Hag sends Wan-Bissaka message after landmark","description":"Former Manchester United defender Aaron Wan-Bissaka opened his account for West Ham after leaving Old Trafford in the summer","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/former-man-united-coach-who-30452124","content":"Former Man United coach who slammed Erik ten Hag sends Aaron Wan-Bissaka message after landmark - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Former Man United coach who slammed Erik ten Hag sends Aaron Wan-Bissaka message after landmark
===============================================================================================

Former Manchester United defender Aaron Wan-Bissaka opened his account for West Ham after leaving Old Trafford in the summer
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/former-man-united-coach-who-30452124#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Stephen Killen](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/stephen-killen/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:30, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: West Ham defender Aaron Wan-Bissaka.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30452144.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186879231.jpg)

Former Manchester United players and coaches sent Aaron Wan-Bissaka a message after his goal for West Ham. (Image: Photo by Stu Forster/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Former Manchester United striker Anthony Martial and ex-goalkeeper David de Gea joined Benni McCarthy in heaping praise on Aaron Wan-Bissaka after opening his West Ham United account.

The Hammers picked up an important win beating Newcastle United 2-0 at St James' Park. Tomas Soucek opened the scoring after 10 minutes before the former United defender doubled the East London side's lead to alleviate some of the pressure building on under fire manager Julen Lopetegui.

West Ham moved six points clear of the bottom three and further away from the likes of Wolves - who picked up an important win away at Fulham - as well as Everton and Leicester City. Wan-Bissaka completed a move back to the capital, following a five-year spell at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), signing for West Ham on a seven-year contract for an undisclosed fee.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

**READ MORE: ['I've never forgotten' - Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana shows his true colours](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ive-never-forgotten-manchester-united-30451660)**

And after 11 [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) outings, the 27-year-old scored his first goal for the Hammers and on Instagram, he wrote: "First in claret & blue. We keep pushing."

Former United teammates Martial, De Gea and Teden Mengi were among those to send support to the full-back. Both Martial and De Gea posted spider emojis while the now-Luton Town defender Mengi added: "Yessirrrrr."

There was also a compliment from former United coach Benni McCarthy. The former Blackburn Rovers striker, who left his role at the Theatre of Dreams in the summer, said: "Nice one Wan B. Well played mate and good goal."

Erik ten Hag wanted to keep McCarthy in the United ranks following his one-year extension in light of the [FA Cup](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/fa-cup) triumph over [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc). The South African opted to part ways and in an interview following his exit, while he praised the Dutchman highly, he noted that the tactician was lacking two key managerial components.

"Tactically Erik is one of the smartest coaches I have ever met. He is intelligent, a very intelligent man," he told Portuguese outlet [Zero Zero](https://www.zerozero.pt/noticias/benni-mccarthy-heroi-portista-separacao-entre-ronaldo-e-ten-hag-era-inevitavel-/682502#google_vignette). "Meticulous, concerned with details.

"He made everything available to the players, he carefully explained every possible and imaginable situation about the game. Then, at the end of the day, it was up to the players to step onto the pitch and give a good response

"In modern football, I believe that players want to see a bit more passion in their coach. They need to feel that the coach is with them and willing to fight alongside them. Tactically, I feel that Erik is at the top. He lacks a bit of that fire, that passion. That’s where we differ, him and I.

"Sometimes I didn’t see in him that passion I speak of. He has a different personality, a different profile. I think that was one of the difficulties that the team and the players encountered."

data: {"title":"Ex-Man Utd coach who slammed Ten Hag sends Wan-Bissaka message after landmark","description":"Former Manchester United defender Aaron Wan-Bissaka opened his account for West Ham after leaving Old Trafford in the summer","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/former-man-united-coach-who-30452124","content":"Former Man United coach who slammed Erik ten Hag sends Aaron Wan-Bissaka message after landmark - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Former Man United coach who slammed Erik ten Hag sends Aaron Wan-Bissaka message after landmark
===============================================================================================

Former Manchester United defender Aaron Wan-Bissaka opened his account for West Ham after leaving Old Trafford in the summer
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/former-man-united-coach-who-30452124#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Stephen Killen](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/stephen-killen/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:30, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: West Ham defender Aaron Wan-Bissaka.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30452144.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186879231.jpg)

Former Manchester United players and coaches sent Aaron Wan-Bissaka a message after his goal for West Ham. (Image: Photo by Stu Forster/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Former Manchester United striker Anthony Martial and ex-goalkeeper David de Gea joined Benni McCarthy in heaping praise on Aaron Wan-Bissaka after opening his West Ham United account.

The Hammers picked up an important win beating Newcastle United 2-0 at St James' Park. Tomas Soucek opened the scoring after 10 minutes before the former United defender doubled the East London side's lead to alleviate some of the pressure building on under fire manager Julen Lopetegui.

West Ham moved six points clear of the bottom three and further away from the likes of Wolves - who picked up an important win away at Fulham - as well as Everton and Leicester City. Wan-Bissaka completed a move back to the capital, following a five-year spell at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), signing for West Ham on a seven-year contract for an undisclosed fee.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

**READ MORE: ['I've never forgotten' - Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana shows his true colours](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ive-never-forgotten-manchester-united-30451660)**

And after 11 [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) outings, the 27-year-old scored his first goal for the Hammers and on Instagram, he wrote: "First in claret & blue. We keep pushing."

Former United teammates Martial, De Gea and Teden Mengi were among those to send support to the full-back. Both Martial and De Gea posted spider emojis while the now-Luton Town defender Mengi added: "Yessirrrrr."

There was also a compliment from former United coach Benni McCarthy. The former Blackburn Rovers striker, who left his role at the Theatre of Dreams in the summer, said: "Nice one Wan B. Well played mate and good goal."

Erik ten Hag wanted to keep McCarthy in the United ranks following his one-year extension in light of the [FA Cup](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/fa-cup) triumph over [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc). The South African opted to part ways and in an interview following his exit, while he praised the Dutchman highly, he noted that the tactician was lacking two key managerial components.

"Tactically Erik is one of the smartest coaches I have ever met. He is intelligent, a very intelligent man," he told Portuguese outlet [Zero Zero](https://www.zerozero.pt/noticias/benni-mccarthy-heroi-portista-separacao-entre-ronaldo-e-ten-hag-era-inevitavel-/682502#google_vignette). "Meticulous, concerned with details.

"He made everything available to the players, he carefully explained every possible and imaginable situation about the game. Then, at the end of the day, it was up to the players to step onto the pitch and give a good response

"In modern football, I believe that players want to see a bit more passion in their coach. They need to feel that the coach is with them and willing to fight alongside them. Tactically, I feel that Erik is at the top. He lacks a bit of that fire, that passion. That’s where we differ, him and I.

"Sometimes I didn’t see in him that passion I speak of. He has a different personality, a different profile. I think that was one of the difficulties that the team and the players encountered."

data: {"title":"Ex-Man Utd coach who slammed Ten Hag sends Wan-Bissaka message after landmark","description":"Former Manchester United defender Aaron Wan-Bissaka opened his account for West Ham after leaving Old Trafford in the summer","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/former-man-united-coach-who-30452124","content":"Former Man United coach who slammed Erik ten Hag sends Aaron Wan-Bissaka message after landmark - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Former Man United coach who slammed Erik ten Hag sends Aaron Wan-Bissaka message after landmark
===============================================================================================

Former Manchester United defender Aaron Wan-Bissaka opened his account for West Ham after leaving Old Trafford in the summer
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/former-man-united-coach-who-30452124#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Stephen Killen](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/stephen-killen/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:30, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: West Ham defender Aaron Wan-Bissaka.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30452144.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186879231.jpg)

Former Manchester United players and coaches sent Aaron Wan-Bissaka a message after his goal for West Ham. (Image: Photo by Stu Forster/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Former Manchester United striker Anthony Martial and ex-goalkeeper David de Gea joined Benni McCarthy in heaping praise on Aaron Wan-Bissaka after opening his West Ham United account.

The Hammers picked up an important win beating Newcastle United 2-0 at St James' Park. Tomas Soucek opened the scoring after 10 minutes before the former United defender doubled the East London side's lead to alleviate some of the pressure building on under fire manager Julen Lopetegui.

West Ham moved six points clear of the bottom three and further away from the likes of Wolves - who picked up an important win away at Fulham - as well as Everton and Leicester City. Wan-Bissaka completed a move back to the capital, following a five-year spell at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), signing for West Ham on a seven-year contract for an undisclosed fee.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109)**

**READ MORE: ['I've never forgotten' - Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana shows his true colours](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ive-never-forgotten-manchester-united-30451660)**

And after 11 [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) outings, the 27-year-old scored his first goal for the Hammers and on Instagram, he wrote: "First in claret & blue. We keep pushing."

Former United teammates Martial, De Gea and Teden Mengi were among those to send support to the full-back. Both Martial and De Gea posted spider emojis while the now-Luton Town defender Mengi added: "Yessirrrrr."

There was also a compliment from former United coach Benni McCarthy. The former Blackburn Rovers striker, who left his role at the Theatre of Dreams in the summer, said: "Nice one Wan B. Well played mate and good goal."

Erik ten Hag wanted to keep McCarthy in the United ranks following his one-year extension in light of the [FA Cup](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/fa-cup) triumph over [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc). The South African opted to part ways and in an interview following his exit, while he praised the Dutchman highly, he noted that the tactician was lacking two key managerial components.

"Tactically Erik is one of the smartest coaches I have ever met. He is intelligent, a very intelligent man," he told Portuguese outlet [Zero Zero](https://www.zerozero.pt/noticias/benni-mccarthy-heroi-portista-separacao-entre-ronaldo-e-ten-hag-era-inevitavel-/682502#google_vignette). "Meticulous, concerned with details.

"He made everything available to the players, he carefully explained every possible and imaginable situation about the game. Then, at the end of the day, it was up to the players to step onto the pitch and give a good response

"In modern football, I believe that players want to see a bit more passion in their coach. They need to feel that the coach is with them and willing to fight alongside them. Tactically, I feel that Erik is at the top. He lacks a bit of that fire, that passion. That’s where we differ, him and I.

"Sometimes I didn’t see in him that passion I speak of. He has a different personality, a different profile. I think that was one of the difficulties that the team and the players encountered."

Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes
======================================================================

Manchester United's new era under Ruben Amorim began with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town where the new 3-4-3 system was debuted
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Manchester United have been told to write this season off after a historically poor start to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) under Erik ten Hag.

[The Dutchman](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) was fired by Ineos on October 28 following a 2-1 defeat at West Ham United. After he left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on the Monday, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) wasted little time finding his successor with Ruben Amorim appointed the following Friday.

Due to an agreement with Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) did not begin work at Old Trafford until Monday, November 11 - the start of the final international break of the year. As such, his first match in charge of the club came on Sunday when United drew 1-1 at Ipswich Town despite taking the lead inside 90 seconds.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on three United weaknesses during warm-ups](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE: [United have new contender for key Amorim role](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

Of course, it will take longer than one match to implement a new style on this United team but former Arsenal winger Theo Walcott believes the Reds need to let this season go particularly with such a relentless run of games between now and the new year. He told [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/): "That \[implementing a new season\] is the difficulty he is going to have at this part of the season.

"The November/December period before [Christmas](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/christmas) is for me always an interesting time where it is all about recovery for the players. I think at times now, the players are just going to have to get on with it and need to learn really quickly.

"They will do a lot of walkthrough, I would have thought, but they need to get in the habits, plant the seed which will be repetition, repetition just to adapt to the system. They will have to learn very quickly but I think as well, they need to just write off this season.

"It has been a long time \[of pain\] for [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and they are going to have to accept that as they have got the man they want now. But, how long will they stay in this system particularly when they want to get results?"

===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes
======================================================================

Manchester United's new era under Ruben Amorim began with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town where the new 3-4-3 system was debuted
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   09:45, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30450440.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664130.jpg)

Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United have been told to write this season off after a historically poor start to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) under Erik ten Hag.

[The Dutchman](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) was fired by Ineos on October 28 following a 2-1 defeat at West Ham United. After he left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on the Monday, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) wasted little time finding his successor with Ruben Amorim appointed the following Friday.

Due to an agreement with Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) did not begin work at Old Trafford until Monday, November 11 - the start of the final international break of the year. As such, his first match in charge of the club came on Sunday when United drew 1-1 at Ipswich Town despite taking the lead inside 90 seconds.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on three United weaknesses during warm-ups](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE: [United have new contender for key Amorim role](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

Of course, it will take longer than one match to implement a new style on this United team but former Arsenal winger Theo Walcott believes the Reds need to let this season go particularly with such a relentless run of games between now and the new year. He told [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/): "That \[implementing a new season\] is the difficulty he is going to have at this part of the season.

"The November/December period before [Christmas](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/christmas) is for me always an interesting time where it is all about recovery for the players. I think at times now, the players are just going to have to get on with it and need to learn really quickly.

"They will do a lot of walkthrough, I would have thought, but they need to get in the habits, plant the seed which will be repetition, repetition just to adapt to the system. They will have to learn very quickly but I think as well, they need to just write off this season.

"It has been a long time \[of pain\] for [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and they are going to have to accept that as they have got the man they want now. But, how long will they stay in this system particularly when they want to get results?"

===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes
======================================================================

Manchester United's new era under Ruben Amorim began with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town where the new 3-4-3 system was debuted
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   09:45, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30450440.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664130.jpg)

Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United have been told to write this season off after a historically poor start to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) under Erik ten Hag.

[The Dutchman](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) was fired by Ineos on October 28 following a 2-1 defeat at West Ham United. After he left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on the Monday, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) wasted little time finding his successor with Ruben Amorim appointed the following Friday.

Due to an agreement with Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) did not begin work at Old Trafford until Monday, November 11 - the start of the final international break of the year. As such, his first match in charge of the club came on Sunday when United drew 1-1 at Ipswich Town despite taking the lead inside 90 seconds.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on three United weaknesses during warm-ups](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE: [United have new contender for key Amorim role](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

Of course, it will take longer than one match to implement a new style on this United team but former Arsenal winger Theo Walcott believes the Reds need to let this season go particularly with such a relentless run of games between now and the new year. He told [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/): "That \[implementing a new season\] is the difficulty he is going to have at this part of the season.

"The November/December period before [Christmas](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/christmas) is for me always an interesting time where it is all about recovery for the players. I think at times now, the players are just going to have to get on with it and need to learn really quickly.

"They will do a lot of walkthrough, I would have thought, but they need to get in the habits, plant the seed which will be repetition, repetition just to adapt to the system. They will have to learn very quickly but I think as well, they need to just write off this season.

"It has been a long time \[of pain\] for [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and they are going to have to accept that as they have got the man they want now. But, how long will they stay in this system particularly when they want to get results?"
